title: Nice hotel in a good location
text: Super cute hotel in midtown with a great location and a funky design. Rooms are small but that is normal for NYC. Rooms were wuiet enough. And the hotel staff was very kind and helped with whatever we needed: I would definitely stay here again.

title: Great stay
text:
Everything was great about this hotel. The staff are friendly and are sure to see your stay went well. Good location, clean and the rooms were nice. 

Didn't stay long or get to use much of the other services but I would easily book here again. May not be one of the top Hyatt Centics and falls more in line of a Hyatt Place but otherwise it's a fine hotel.

title: Great location
text: Spent the weekend in NYC with friends and for the NYC half marathon.  The hotel is in a great location and close to Times Square.  The staff was friendly and helpful throughout our entire stay.  The rooms are small but typical for NYC.  The bed was too soft for my liking.  The bathrooms could use better lighting.  Overall, had a great time and would definitely stay here again the next time I visit NYC.

title: horrible
text: When we arrived at the hotel, they asked for a $600 deposit. We questioned this and they agreed to only take a $100 deposit. However, the next day they made a second transaction of $500 without our authorization. Due to this issue and the limited breakfast options, we have decided to avoid staying at this hotel in the future. The staff also seemed to be untruthful, which is why we would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Ignore the negative reviews and book this hotel!
text: Was in two minds about booking this hotel however what I can say is book the hotel ignore the bad reviews. Upon check in we got a free room upgrade , we were also given water for our room free of charge, we were asked if we would need to get a taxi back to the airport upon check out all working less than five mins. After a long day of travelling that is just what you need quick and efficient service. All staff members are pleasant , friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is nice you have shopping around but it is a little more quick than the busiest parts of the city making it a nice place for relaxation while not missing out on the city activities as everything is really close by. Train stations are within walking distance and just a short walk down is a lot of restaurants and stores. The rooms are well equipped with additional lighting should you requireore lighting , the bed we super comfortable and the bathroom was modern and clean.Thank you Hyatt Centric.

title: Great hotel
text:
This was our second visit to New York and we really enjoyed our visit at this outstanding hotel. 
The hotel is in a great location with plenty of things to do within easy walking distance so no need to use taxis or subway to enjoy your trip.
We will definitely be staying here next time we visit.

title: Go for it !
text:
Location-wise it's perfect, literally 100m from 5th Avenue, 10min walk from Times Square, 15min from the Empire State Building, 10min from Grand Central Station.

On the hotel side, nothing to say, cleanliness is essential, room service comes every day and changes all the towels.
The reception is attentive to our expectations.

title: Worst stay in a Hyatt Hotel
text: Stayed in most Hyatt properties in NY and this is by far the worst, Dark depressing room, with a very poor view, could not tell who was a staff member or the public. Noisey room, woke up in the early house people running around the corridor. Moved rooms 4 times, Lift noise, Noise out side, would not return to this hotel and suprised its in the Hyatt hotel chain

title: Great location! Clean and comfortable
text: Lovely hotel right beside everything was within walking distance to Times Square,Grand Central, Empire State, Vanderbilt! Not too far to Central Park either! Street location felt safe a little loud at night with sirens etc but not the hotels fault and also you’re in NYC!! Beds were super comfy, room was really clean plus the hairdryer was really good which from experience can be a gamble not bringing your own! Only con we had requested an earlier check in which maybe due to availability wasn’t granted , the room wasn’t ready when we arrived they said they would text when the room was ready so we went for a ramble for a few hours and had to go back and ask if the room was ready yet which it didn’t seem it was so we were given someone else’s room who hadn’t arrived yet but it gave us more time to explore the city! The air con was a bit noisy but after all the walking during the day we slept through it! Didn’t use the restaurant but seemed busy all the time went to the rooftop bar service was excellent drinks a little pricey but to be expected! Would stay again!

title: Great choice!
text: The location of the hotel is wonderful, and the hotel is excellent.  Great service and very clean.  The attached restaurant was delicious. I really enjoyed the rooftop bar!  Quite the view of the Empire State Building.  I would stay here again.

title: Choose elsewhere
text: A poor Hyatt experience.  Front desk told me that the restaurant on site has 'nothing to do with the hotel and is under separate owners'. No room service as advertised. No snacks/mini-bar. If wanting to stay in the Hyatt family choose the Grayson hotel (rated a category lower by Hyatt, but much better than this Category 6)-  I had a much better experience there on a prior trip.

title: New York New York
text: Great location for a city trip. Almost everything is accessible on foot or by subway or bus: Broadway, museums and much more. The hotel leaves a modern and clean impression; appears to have been recently renovated. Spacious rooms and large shower for NY standards.

title: Extended stay in New York
text: Hotel with excellent facilities and great service, close to everything we like in New York. I highly recommend it. We spent 10 wonderful days at this hotel. We stayed in the room with two very comfortable beds.

title: The location is great.
text: Locations is great! Theres a lot of restaurants near by and walking distance to main attractions. Also, close to the train station. Its about a 15-20 minute walk to time square. The rooms are small but nice.

title: Excellent hotel in great location
text: From the moment of arrival, staff were friendly and welcoming (as well as every time we passed by reception).  Lifts were speedy, rooms well appointed and beautifully decorated and the hotel has a wonderfully central location.  I just wish I had known about the fabulous views from the rooftop bar earlier!!!  I will return!

title: Recommend - Great Experience
text: We stayed here for 10 days over the Christmas/New Year period.  Overall it was a great hotel, easy walking distance to lots of attractions, Empire State, Time Square, Rockefeller etc.  Bryant Park was very close, we always felt safe walking to and from the hotel. Our room had a great view of the Empire State Building, magnificent!  The room was very quiet from any outside noise however a few times we our neighbours came home late annd they were noisy, we thought they were in our room!  The rest of the time no problem.  The air con is very loud but offset by the large room and separate toilet in the bathroom.  We were told at check in our room would be serviced on request however it was serviced daily.  Elevators were fast and we rarely had anyone else in the lift with us.  The rooftop bar was incredible, only had a drink here no food. Overall we recommend this hotel, especially good for first timers like us.

title: Vulgarization of an exquisite "glamour"
text:
After having been to several Hyatt "brand" hotels in Europe: "Louvre-Hyatt", "Marlene Dietricht Berlin" with exquisite attention and service, we came across a North American version of the company, and the truth is that I regret having done so. . The 2 rooms were not completely adjoining, as requested, they are separated by a space, due to the constant noise of engines, occupied by the internal air conditioning units.
The cleanliness of the hotel leaves something to be desired: apart from the fact that there are bottles, plastic bags and glasses that remain for hours and hours in the corridors, our rooms were left without cleaning or making the beds: on the 30th and the 31st, Even though on the 30th we spoke with the manager at 5:30 p.m., when we returned from a busy day and, eager for a refreshing shower, we found the bed unmade, without clean towels. Once the complaint has been made, the manager appears and apologizes, citing an increase in people in the hotel and promises that it will not happen again. Well, thank goodness it was compromised, because the 31st was worse, we arrived at 6:45 p.m. and the situation was worse: Nothing had been touched in the room since our departure at 7:30 a.m.: that is, almost 12 hours. And no one had touched anything. I went to complain to the reception, why they were not answering the phone and when I arrived and saw that the receptionist was almost alone, I asked him why he was not answering the phone and he replied that he had had a very stressful day and when I asked him about the "non-cleaning "From the rooms he told me that it was not his concern, that he had his job (he was talking to a beautiful lady). When I demanded action, he disdainfully contacted someone and half an hour later a young lady arrived with a couple of bath towels and two hand towels.
A terrible experience.

title: Optimum price at great location
text:
Location was close to most great places of Manhattan. Very convenient room with king size bed. Lighting of room was amazing.

Jshdvjskdb sjbdhd sksbjsbdbd sjjsbdjsndvidjsbdjwojhdisnvdkwbdjdjaknsbdkwbdbdjjwns

title: Christmas Weekend
text: The hotel and staff are exceptional.  The elevators are the fastest I've experienced in a hotel.  The room was not as advertised - a room with a city view and balcony.  The room had neither available.  The coffee service was weak.  I ended up buying my own coffee at the CVS.

title: Great stay!
text: The rooms are fantastic. The service isn’t the best but I was able to overlook that’s. I booked a standard king room. I received an ADA room for some reason but I actually preferred it. Service needs some fine tuning but I will stay again!

title: Holiday business trip! ✨
text:
When I arrived I was greeted by beautiful young lady Alice. Very approachable and professional, very pleasant. She explained all about the hotel amenities as well as the rooftop bar. She was very kind! Another lady was Shanelle (very unique and she must be proud having a very special name!).
• The lobby and lounge area was clean, neat and nice decorated for coming Holidays!
• The Elevators were good, fast, not a long wait to get one.
• The Hallways were nice, bright during the day, lights were lower during the night. Nice pictures!
• Room: nice, I can say clean, even the bathroom sink had some hair, as well as towels, that part was a little dirty, but anyway nice room. The only thing what was annoying was that I had a room which was on the 4th floor. When I book the next reservation I’d request higher floor for sure, because at this point all day or night I all I heard was public transportation. During my business meeting it was so loud. As well my window was looking towards building cross the street and all I can see is a guy staring to hotel, literally every time I took a look during the night there was a man standing and looking to our hotel. Kinda creepy. 
Overall, a nice area, nice hotel and very kind and helpful staff! Will be back!!!

Happy Holidays!
Merry Christmas to all Hyatt team! ♥️

title: Great Location
text:
Great location; we enjoyed the view from the rooftop bar.  NO affiliated parking garage; NO parking discount with their recommended parking garage.
Front desk Charlemagne made us feel welcome on check in
The staff at the rooftop bar were great; food at the bar was also good.  They served dinner.

title: Great location, paper thin walls!
text: This hotel is in a great location at 5th ave and 39th right near everything.  We walked everywhere and it was easy to navigate.  The hotel rooms are beautiful but the walls are paper thin and at numerous times, I checked to see if somehow the window was open because I could hear conversations on the street as well as in neighbouring rooms.  Don't go there without ear plugs.  But otherwise, a great hotel.

title: Clean, Convenient and Close Walking Distance to Our Office!
text: Excellent hotel! Staff was warm and friendly, room was super clean and had everything I needed. We had a company dinner at the hotel restaurant and the food was incredible, as was the service. Very happy to stay here in the future. Walking distance to our office, to Bryant Park and many surrounding options.

title: Awesome hotel
text: This hotel is very clean, modern and our room was roomy for a NYC hotel room. We were pleasantly surprised compared to other hotels we’ve stayed at in Manhattan by the size. The front desk was very helpful and got us a room right away (and early!). The location on this hotel is awesome. It is close walk from grand central and all of the touristy areas but tucked away enough that it’s still quiet. Overall we had a great experience at this hotel and will consider it for our next overnight stay in NYC.

title: Distinctly average
text:
Check in was painful as the hotel had been booked through a company travel agency. Despite breakfast being included in the rate I was only give a breakfast voucher after the travel agency called the hotel twice. 
Room was ok. Clean and comfortable. 
The restaurant where breakfast was served was AWFUL. Staff generally rude and unhelpful.

title: Memorable stay’
text:
We had an absolutely fantastic stay at this amazing hotel.
The service, location and quality were all outstanding. The staff were all so kind and helpful. Steps away from one of our favourite spots, Bryant Park and close to Time Square. Location can’t be beat. We had our best meal in NYC at Ramerino Italian Prime located in the hotel. Outstanding authentic Italian food.. Don’t miss out and book this hotel and restaurant. You will be glad you did. A huge thank you to the GM, Anthony Damiano, for making our stay a memorable one. My daughter’s Sweet 16 weekend getaway was perfect!

title: Good location, good experience
text:
Spent only one night and the stay was overall positive, though the rooms feel smaller than what the web site's photographs make it appear, at least mine did. Clearly a building that was not originally a hotel, with odd-shaped rooms giving it some character and charm. 

The hotel did not strike me as a place to spend more than a few nights and the elevator lobby gets cramped quickly. Coffee shop is a great place to start the day. Overall the staff was pleasant and very helpful, especially with handling deliveries to the hotel for my attention. Sour note, the front desk agent who very clearly did not enjoy checking me in at midnight and would not say one word above the barest of minimum.

title: Quick weekend getaway
text: My wife and I enjoyed a quick weekend escape. We were very pleased with all aspects of the hotel and staff. Anthony and his team took great care of everything. Even the gentleman at the desk at 6AM on a Sunday morning was pleasant! We will be back.

title: Excellent choice to stay in NYC.
text: Perfect hotel in Midtown NYC, small hotel but excellent in service and rooms. Rooms were very clean and nicely decorated. Location is perfect, away from the busling noise of Time Square, yet close enough walking distance to it. Staffs were all very helpfull and friendly as well. Highly recommended.

title: Close to Grand Central, clean hotel
text: Easy walk from Grand Central, nice clean hotel, small rooms but comfortable space. Nice small bar and restaurant attached to hotel. Check in was seamless and friendly employees. I would definitely stay there again.

title: Hyatt Centric was amazing all around
text: From the check in to the check out, the staff was helpful and friendly. All our needs were met to the highest standard! I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a getaway in the city! The cleanliness and beauty of this hotel is spectacular.

title: Great Place
text: This is my second time staying here for business travel and the hotel does not disappoint. It’s in a great location (off 5th) and the food options are great. The rooftop is an added bonus. I would definitely be staying here again if my business travels put me on the east side.

title: Great Value, Perfect Location
text:
Great Value.  Perfect location, updated rooms, convenient food nearby.  Close to 5th Ave. 

I was here for a conference in mid-town and this was walking distance.  For ~$300/night,  this location is unbeatable (Andaz nearby is >$600).

Location:  Short walking distance to 5th Avenue, Bryant Park and Mid-town.  Perfect location for work and leisure. Lots of restaurant and shopping all within short walk.  Subway is nearby as well. 

Lobby:  Open lobby with small sitting area and breakfast buffet served there (free for Globalist). 

Restaurant:  The Italian restaurant next door is excellent, legit Italian food.  

Elevator: 2 small but efficient elevators. 

Room:  As Hyatt Globalist, got a suite upgrade.  The living room was oddly layout but spacious,  had two banquet of funky velvet sofas.  

Bedroom. Separate bedroom is average for NY.  Comfy bed and high quality linens. Note:  limited storage space,  small open closet.  

Bathroom:  Updated, shower only. Clean. 

Loved our stay, will be back.

title: A fuir
text:
A fuir 
L’enseigne et l’emplacement est séduisant mais l’hôtel est vraiment pas dans les normes d’un hôtel à ce tarif il mérite vraiment pas ses 4 étoiles 
Chambres minuscules 
Chambres sombres 
Pas de chauffage 
Pas
De couverture supplémentaire 
Personne inexistant et incompétent
Petit déjeuner null juste du pain avec du beurre et banane

title: Amazing Post Marathon Staycation
text:
Joining the marathon over the weekend and having a hotel you can rely on is beyond amazing. 

The hotel is spotless and the rooms and public spaces are beautiful, even down to the elevators and hallways. Everything is centrally located. I do wish we had stayed longer and explored the other amenities. 

What impressed us more than anything else was the staff - They were genuine, kind,  thoughtful and very accomodating to make a good impression. They took our luggage's even before checking in to get that off our plate while we stressed about the race. Hilton, one of the front desk team took our luggages, remembered our names and checked us in a couple of minutes. It was the most smooth check-in process I have had for a fully booked hotel.The staff were all smiles as soon as we walked in realizing we had a come from the marathon, offered us water and the GM, Anthony personally congratulated us after he knew we were part of it. The personal touches is what gets you and warms your heart.

The staff will ensure you are very well taken care of. They will go above and beyond for your needs and help you in any way they can. They have set the bar high when it comes to customer service. Thank you Hyatt Centric!

title: Absolutely fabulous staff.
text: The staff is very friendly and helpful. I continued to be needy throughout my stay and they were always kind and totally exceeded my expectations. The room was clean, everything was just wonderful. It is a good location, great Italian restaurant, very comfortable. Nothing but praises.

title: Beautiful hotel with a top-notch rooftop bar and perfect location! 😇
text:
This is already my fourth time in this beautiful hotel and it is every time impeccable! 
Great service, incredible location, super helpful staff and amazing rooftop bar with a million (at least) dollar view! 

Would recommend in a blink of an eye!

title: Perfecto en Manhattan
text:
El hotel Hyatt es un lugar muy bien ubicado para una estancia en Manhattan, servicio y condiciones del edificios son muy buenos.
Lo recomiendo y volveré sin duda. 
Me hospedé en una habitación de esquina en el piso 21 vista a la ciudad.-
Personal en general es atento y dispuesto hacer tu estadía perfecta.

title: Great hotel, great location, great customer service
text: The rooms are big for NY standards, and they are newly remodeled, modern, and very clean. The bed was very comfortable and clean. The bathrooms are upscale and comfortable with excellent water pressure. The customer service at the lobby was impeccable. The lobby is small, but modern, updated, and clean.  The Italian restaurant and the rooftop deck bar offer good quality food. I will definitively be back.

title: My 3 Day Adventure in NYC
text:
I recently stayed at the Hyatt Centric Midtown for my 3 day adventure in NYC.  This is the 3rd Hyatt property in NYC I have stayed at and by far my favorite.  Being off of 5th and 39th, the location was great and a short walking distance to many things.  Upon arrival, we were courteously greeted and taken care of right away.  The front desk staff was very friendly and hospitabele. 
They were able to check us in early, upgrade us to a suite, and provided late check out options.  There was always fresh water available and an open coffee bar with delicious muffins and croissants for breakfast.  If you were looking for something more substantial, the restaurant is there to serve you.  A big shout out to Alice and Janette foe being to helpful and accommodating.  Anthony Damiano, you run a great staff.  Can't wait for our next visit.  Until soon, the Texas ladies Crew.

title: Great hotel, nice location
text: This was the first time staying at this hotel.  Great location to everything we had planned on our itinerary.  Nice rooms, comfortable beds,  good water pressure with the shower.  The front desk crew were wonderful.

title: NYC if the fall
text: NYC in the fall is magical. The colours and the crisp air in the mornings. The Hyatt Centric on 39th is well located to truly enjoy the city. The desk staff is friendly and welcoming. Rooms are clean with a great shower and comfortable beds.  The hotel is close to Times Square and Bryant Park. I can’t wait to return.

title: Best Manhattan Hotel for Customer Service and Thoughtfulness!
text: I LOVED the Hotel Management & staff.  They were all so kind & thoughtful while I was staying there after my husband had been seriously injured in Manhattan.  Thanks to Anthony, Katherine, Hilton, Charmaine, Janette, Shanelle, Alice, & the hotel handyman (l wish that I remembered his name.)  The entire staff was wonderful!

title: Really centric and a nice roof top bar
text: Entry hall is nice, friendly receptionist, no wait time. Wireless worked well and I could work from there. Ironing shirts was easy. I booked a room for one person and its size was sufficient. Storage of luggage after check out was for free. I would come again.

title: Great Location
text: Very clean and comfortable hotel in Mid-town.  Enjoyed walking to NY Public Library and Korean BBQ for dinner.  We were able to leave our luggage early.  Paid parking just down the street.  Easy to get in and out!

title: A gem in mid-town Manhattan
text: My wife and I were stranded for 48hours due to the weather after arriving at JFK.  We found this hotel through the Hyatt app and had a fabulous 2-day extension to our vacation.  The location was ideal.  It is close to everything, but on a relatively quiet side street.  The restaurant was very good, and the lounge/bar on the 22nd floor gave an outstanding view of the Empire State Building.

title: Excellent location, great stay
text: We were delighted with the location as it was very central in a quiet area. Our room with two Queens was clean and quite roomy.  Zero noise from inside or outside the building meant a great night's sleep.  The roof top bar was an unexpectedly nice place with a good ambiance.  And the staff there and at the front counter were excellent.

title: Good location but not good experience
text: The location of this property was great, but unfortunately the service didn’t impress. We were greeted warmly by the front desk person and were welcomed as Globalists. This is pretty much the highlight of our two night stay. The rooms were clean and comfortable, but relatively average. We were not upgraded at all, in fact our room looked directly into another building and we were on the 9th floor. It was incredibly noisy at night, even by NYC standards. The breakfast was horrible! The staff were inattentive and unfriendly. After perusing the buffet we decided to order off the menu. We had to flag down a waitress to order. The brioche French toast was like soggy wonder bread. The oatmeal was watery and slimy. We opted to go off site and skip the free breakfast the next morning. When coming and going nobody bothered to hold the door open even when a staff member was standing right there. We will choose a different Hyatt property next time.

title: Hidden gem of a hotel!
text: Hidden gem of a hotel! Perfect location for exploring New York. Great rooms and very comfortable beds! Very friendly and helpful staff. Attached to a great restaurant -Ramerino! And has a wonderful rooftop bar with great view of the Empire State Building! Would definitely stay there again!

title: Consistently Amazing
text: This place keeps getting better and better. The team here always makes me feel like its home. The area is perfect, and it has a boutique hotel type of feel. I would highly recommend staying here on your next nyc trip.

title: Intimate hotel with generous room size and attentive staff
text: Loved the convenient location, fun furnishings and knowledgable staff. Quiet, too, and breakfast (for Globalist members) served in the restaurant versus a club. Above and beyond. Highly recommended! PS Unlike other NYC Hyatts, there's no resort fee added daily!

title: Outstanding from beginning to end!
text: I cannot say enough about all of the staff we encountered at the Hyatt Centric 5th Ave but would especially like to call attention to Jackie at the front desk.  She was so in tune with the needs of our family and in particular, our special needs son.  She was a God send!  The housekeeping staff were attentive and added a special touch of tucking in my boys' plushies in the bed when they were made! And while a separate entity, the A to Z rooftop lounge staff were so welcoming to our young boys, even making lemonade from "scratch" at the boys' request.  We will most assuredly be back and highly recommend this hotel to any family looking to stay in midtown Manhattan!

title: Hyatt Centric 39th and 5th
text: What makes this hotel exceptional is it staff and service. Great location in midtown. Room was clean with very comfortable bedding. A to Z rooftop bar was perfect after a long day of sightseeing. A quick thank you to hotel general manager Anthony Damiano for quickly addressing HVAC issue. HVAC stayed on 24/7 with no air flow. I would definitely recommend Hyatt Centric 39th and 5th.

title: Acceptable EXCEPT ONE ISSUE
text:
The hotel is generally acceptable, front desk staff pleasant.  It’s NY, so rooms are small, which is ok.  Good location if you want to be in midtown.  Smallest sink I’ve ever seen in a hotel or anywhere for that matter. .  .

BUT, the HVAC system is TERRIBLE.  All night, it turns on and off about every 10 minutes, makes the room too cold, then it waits until you are sweating and turns on again.  The temperature was set at 70 - we didn’t touch the thermostat.  

But that’s not the worst.  The vents are positioned so that the air blows DIRECTLY  on you while you lay in bed.  You could catch pneumonia! It’s unpleasant, disturbs sleep, and ruins the entire evening.  The best assessment of a hotel is whether or not you can get a pleasant, restful night’s sleep. This hotel fails on that count, at least in the room we received.  Ask before you stay about the venting location - if it is across from the bed.

That said, while it wouldn’t solve all the problems, at least they could add a plastic diffuser to the vent to reduce the air from blowing on guests while in bed.   How does a hotel not know about this problem and do something about it?  I would expect that from Hilton, but not Hyatt.  

A good hotel is all about the details.  Those that don’t pay attention to details or put profit above the details of the guest experience should be avoided.

title: Employees who listen are here…..
text:
People working here makes this place give a wonderful experience. Katherine, a Front Office Supervisor, listened to my requests earnestly and made them happen. 
In all, she went way above and beyond and I truly appreciate her sincerity!!

title: Wonderful guest rooms
text: Much larger rooms than expected in midtown NY.  Super comfy king bed.  High quality linens and pillows. Modern spacious bathroom.  Even had a large upholstered arm chair with ottoman - rare in Manhattan. Wood (or wood tile?) floors. Black out shades. Remarkably quiet on the 17th floor.  Plenty of AC outlets and USB ports everywhere.  Well-designed desk.  Hanging space and high quality glass door mini-fridge.  Housekeeping every day.  Huge flatscreen TV (maybe 65 inches) with a generous channel selection.  Perfect midtown location on E. 39th Street.  CVS open late around the corner.  My new go to midtown hotel.

title: Quiet Retreat Near Times Square
text: This is a great hotel near Times Square.  The rooms are on the small side but are very quiet which made for restful sleeping. The staff was very professional and responded quickly to a couple of requests that we made.

title: Ritorno a New York
text: Conosco per lavoro gli Hyatt e ho scelto per questo. La posizione è comoda, al centro di Manhattan, vicino a Grand Central e un po' meno a Penn Station o Times Square, molte linee di metropolitana a pochi minuti a piedi; ma l'hotel occupa uno spazio relativamente ristretto tra due fabbricati e si sviluppa esclusivamente in altezza, ci sono non più di una decina di stanze per piano.  La camere sono ben insonorizzate, spazi piuttosto sacrificati per quanto ben gestiti, bene l'area toilette. Il bar al roof è inevitabilmente sacrificato per spazio che viene sovrastato dagli edifici confinanti, la vista sull'Empire non basta a rendere esclusivo il tutto. Bene la pulizia, anche la dotazione di asciugamani ( ma non disponibili accappatoi). Disponibili porte USB per ricaricare cellulare. Buono il Wi-Fi.  Non sempre cordiale il personale all'accoglienza. Prezzi un po' alti nel complesso.

title: Excellent quiet hotel in the middle of midtown
text:
Excellent hotel in the middle of midtown with very good customer service and very quiet rooms
The Good
- Location is perfect, 1 block from Bryant Park, walking distance to Broadway, Times Square and several subway stations
- Room faced a courtyard, which made it extremely quiet.  Normally you hear sirens in NYC or doors closing late at night from people partying.  However, we heard only complete silence
- Rooftop bar really nice for a drink overlooking the city
- Parking available 1 block away with a hotel discount for $65/night
- Staff was extremely nice
The Bad
- Rooms are very small.  This is normal in NYC but very crowded for a family of 3.  However, space is used well and room has everything you need.
- No dual queen size bed options.

title: Classy, well-positioned in midtown Manhattan
text:
I was in town attending my father's funeral, and chose this hotel because of an Amex Offer for Hyatt Centric and because the location was perfectly positioned in the city for my plans.  My Hyatt elite benefits were recognized at check-in, I got the military veteran rate, and the WoH app worked flawlessly for the stay.  The hotel is a 10-minute walk from Times Square and the Empire State Building, is nestled near all of the major subway lines running throughout New York City, and yet is a classy, quiet spot in a very vibrant area.  I had a serious problem initially during my stay which was promptly and professionally dealt with personally by the general manager (Anthony D.) and director of operations (Greg) to my complete satisfaction.  

The hotel is in very good condition, is tastefully decorated in a colorful, yet subdued motif, the rooftop observation deck has a great view of the Empire State building, and this stay increased my affinity for the Hyatt Centric brand's emphasis on location.  Just like the Centric Montrêal, it's very close to what you want to see, and getting around NYC on the subway is a cinch.  It caters to millennials without being crass and party-like...more like a classy business casual hotel.  A button-up shirt and slacks, no tie.

This stay made a difficult time much easier for me, I was treated very well overall, and I highly recommend the hotel.

title: Great hotel and staff
text: Hotel was convenient to Grand central and suited our travel plans. Staff was fantastic from checkin through checkout. Our room was a corner suite and very comfortable.  Rooftop was a pleasant surprise and a great intimate space to have a quiet drink and food.

title: A gem of a smaller hotel
text: Perfectly located in mid-town, Hyatt Centric is lovely and understated.  Fairly large room for NYC, friendly and unobtrusive. The bonus is a rooftop bar with a stunning view of the Empire State Building. Also, surprisingly quiet.

title: Best Hotel Experience in Midtown!!
text: Entire hotel and restaurant staff were superb, even during a very hectic time.  Every opportunity I have to come to NYC, my go to destination is Hyatt Centric Midtown NYC.  Really appreciate the welcoming nature of the entire staff!

title: Excellent stay.   Very new and modern room and great location.
text:
Excellent stay.   Very new and modern room and great location.  

A great choice if you will have to be around midtown area of NYC

Also, the general manager Anthony is awesome!    He leads by example.

The one downside is that the Italian restaurant on first floor has unfriendly service and doesn’t deliver room service (when it’s busy).    

Other than that.   This hotel is a great choice.

title: Fantastic view of Empire State Building & Convenient to Grand Central Station
text:
Our high floor city view reservation got us an incredible view of the city, including the Empire State Building just outside our large window.  We picked the Hyatt Centric Midtown because the rooms were a bit larger than most major hotels and because of the convenient walk of less than 10 minutes to Grand Central Station and less than 20 minutes to Penn Station.  

The staff was friendly and the hotel was clean.  Attention to detail was obvious and made our stay comfortable.  Our room was cleaned daily and it was nice to come back to fresh sheets and towels and a newly made bed.  

Our reservation came with breakfast and we took advantage of this every day of our weeklong stay.  Food was excellent!  Two days during the week there was a breakfast buffet and the other days we dined off of the regular menu which had a variety of choices (we enjoyed all that we tried!).

Give this hotel a try on your next visit to NYC!

title: Fantastic Stay!!
text: Best hotel experience I've had i years (and I'm a 100+ nights a year in hotels, guy).  Staff was excellent.  Everyone I came in contact with greeted me with a smile, a "hello" and a "how is your stay going?" Manager in Lobby saying hi to guests- when was last time that happened to you- right?

title: Pleasant Midranger
text:
New hotels have grown faster than people in Manhattan.  This is another office building conversion and it has many of the admirable touches associated with Hyatt. Very friendly staff, mostly quiet rooms, excellent lighting in the bathroom, high standards of cleanliness, a fine sit down a la carte breakfast; decent mattress, ample charging outlets, large flat screen television.

while the lobby is a bit cramped, and so to the hallways, the three elevators are blazingly fast and the inner courtyard while homely keeps noise down.

The A/C, as several have noted, is efficient, but sounds much like a car ferry racing out of a berth. Instead of white noise, it could make it difficult to sleep.

The Sunday rate was New York reasonable. The weekday rate is a bit steep, but the location is very convenient for business, sightseeing.

They have much competition at this price point, but it is a decent choice.

title: Excellent time at Hyatt Midtown
text:
Our stay at the Hyatt Midtown was amazing.  Hotel staff provided excellent customer service, the hotel is kept in optimal conditions.  The rooms are very modern with plenty of room for a couple. The beds are super comfy and the whole vive in the hotel was just excellent. 
Shout outs to Arlene at the main reception, she took care of us like no other.  Can't wait to be back.

title: Will be back!
text: Anthony went out of his way to make sure our stay was good for us. The location is perfect in the city. Very safe, great walking distance to all the good things to see. Will only stay here when visiting Manhattan.

title: Pretty Good
text:
Room was quite small, a little dark, but had a nice design. It was also well stocked with coffee and tea pods and good soaps and shampoos. Staff overall was super friendly with everyone saying hello. 

Breakfast was good with Globalists being allowed to order anything off the menu. I like breakfast

The gym was cramped but had excellent dumbbells. That was a plus as too many hotels have limited dumbbell choice. But aside from dumbbells there was not much else. 

Location is excellent. I'd stay here again if the price was right but some rates seem sky high and overpriced for what you get when I searched other dates. This is not a luxurious place. Not at all.

title: Perfect for the vacationing traveler
text: I stayed at this Hyatt in June of 2023. It was really easy to get to from Grand Central. The front desk staff were very helpful. The room was small and didn’t have a great view but was easy to get to, quiet, and had everything I needed. If there were 4 people it might be a snug fit bit for the price it was great. I had seen some negative reviews and really not sure why. Location is excellent as well.

title: TRES BON EMPLACEMENT
text: Nous avons séjournés dans cet hôtel pendant 5 nuits, les 2 premières je n ai pas fermé l œil tellement il faisait chaud la clim ne fonctionnait pas, malgré mes 2 demandes d intervention le pb n a pas été résolu. le 3 -ème jour je suis retournée a la réception pour faire part de mon mécontentement et là un grand merci à ALICE qui a été réactive et nous a donné une autre chambre ou  nous avons enfin vu la différence. Mis a part cela les chambres sont propres et de taille correcte, avec une salle de bain fonctionnelle mais le tout manque un peu de luminosité et de rangement. L emplacement est très bien. Nous avons pris un verre sur le toit avec  une vue sur l'Empire State Building(c était le top).

title: 1st Time at this location
text: Great overall location and hotel with a nice roof top to enjoy with friends. Rooms were very stylish and felt like a boutique hotel experience. Roof top has a view of the empire state building which was a bonus!

title: NYC Hyatt @ 5th and 39th
text: Location, location, location! Hotel was clean, modern, and well maintained. Room was nice with a great view of the city. Staff was friendly and helpful. Rooftop bar was nice with a great view of the city.

title: Excellent choice of accommodations
text: Overall excellent experience. Left with the notion of coming back to this hotel again. From the moment I walked into the hotel I was greeted professionally and I felt valued. The hotel was clean and the room was nice as well as clean. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family.

title: Close to Time Square but far enough away avoid the crowds and the crazy.
text: Great location with easy access to Times Square, Broadway, Grand Central and other tourist hotspots, but far enough away for a little quiet.  It’s a newer hotel, which means there’s plenty of places to plug in your tech.

title: Wonderful Service
text: The hotel was very clean and centrally located.  The staff helped our family of 5 get rooms together.  They provided a late checkout and helped arrange a car to the airport.  It was a wonderful stay, and I would recommend the hotel to others.

title: DONT BOTHER WITH THIS PROPERTY
text:
Location was great....
Breakfast and attention given by server was great
Rooms are super compact and very very dark

BUT HERES WHY I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS PROPERTY
General manager was made aware of a situation that happened with a delivery from Uber that was delivered to the front desk...and then suddenly disappears. I never heard from anyone

I confirmed with front desk about protocols when having a delivery brought and they assured me it would be kept for me 
I called mid day while we were out sightseeing 
and was told packaged had arrived and was being held at the FRONT DESK

I returned back to the hotel after 5:00pm and it had vanished..no one knew anything, no one saw what happened. They told me I must have called the wrong Hyatt and maybe reach out to Uber...Uber sent a picture of the package on the desk with a time of delivery 11:13am

I could go on and on but heres my take, when there is a level of dishonesty and a level of mistrust coupled with it trying to be covered up by senior management then I say this,  there are hundreds of hotels in New York with great location as a selling feature. I have yet to hear back from Mr. Velo OR the General Manager Mr. Damiano about this incident and for that reason and the complete lack of service from those at the top I DONT recommend this hotel. Your staff are a direct reflection of your management team and in my opinion as a seasoned traveller both need a complete overhaul.

title: Small, dark room with no view
text:
Ok, my bad, I booked the wrong hyatt centric. We had stayed at 45th st before-friendly staff, great location for theatre, nice view from big window. 
The hotel at 5th and 39th is awful- beaten up, no view, not particularly convenient. A/C very loud when it turned on. Staff not responsive. Not cheap either. Couldnt wait to leave

title: It's the location that makes the difference
text: The hotel is located is a perfect spot to discover NY. 25 meters from 5th Ave and in the middle of everything. The reception and staff are very friendly and service minded. Check in is quick. As with most hotels in NY, the rooms are very small, dark because of the high rises outside and loud. The beds were fine, but the room is only for sleeping. It's a good hotel if you want to discover NY in the summer time, and don't depend on your room that much. Although, the rooms are clean and offer you everything for a good night stay.

title: Great service!
text: This hotel is unassuming in looks, but big on customer service! Andrea at the front desk is dazzling and super charming! As are all the front desk staff. The team was vey quick to offer answers to questions and even go above and beyond for the extra touch. Thank you!

title: Clean and charming hotel
text: We had a great experience staying at this hotel. Very clean and quiet. Convenient location to many NY attractions such as Time Square, Madison Square Garden. The staff was very friendly and professional.  Highly recommend.

title: Amazing Hotel and Location
text: The rooms were a bit small but welcome to NYC.  The room was spotless and had everything I needed.  Even free water!  Woohoo!  The staff were extremely friendly and helpful.  The fitness center is good with cardio machines and weights.  The location of the hotel was amazing.  short walk to Bryant park which was our breakfast place each morning.  Also a short walk to Times Square.  I loved being near Times Square but not in it.  Definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Excellent staff
text: When the air condition in the room wasn’t working, the staff was more than accommodating to fix the situation, without making us feel like an inconvenience. They orchestrated a room switch in the middle of the night and set us up for the next day while we were out for our event.

title: Very Pleasant and Serviceable Hotel
text: This is a well-kept hotel with pleasant staff in a great central location. I stayed for a week for work and I was very comfortable. There are plentiful restaurants in the area and I enjoyed ending the day at the on-site bar.

title: Another Great Stay
text: I have been staying at this hotel off and on for over 6 months. Staff are friendly and facilities are great. Good location as Bryant Park is right around the corner and Ramerinos makes I very good complimentary breakfast as part of your stay as a Globalist so if you travel frequently definitely worth stopping in

title: Home away from home.
text: I am grateful to have found this gem of a place.  Everyone is committed to your stay being fantastic.  It's lovely to be addressed by your name even when you return even after a long while.  The location is excellent.

title: Good location, newer hotel and professional service
text:
I work in midtown Manhattan and stayed here after a late dinner. Hotel is newer. Rooms are clean and efficient. The staff were some of the nicest, most professional team I have met. Check in was easy. The manager was personally greeting guests the next morning in the lobby.
 I observed the night staff engaging 4 out of town visitors on the best things to see in NY and also sending a bottle of prosecco to them to enjoy. Kudos to this team

title: Great location and nice hotel
text: Great hotel in midtown. The beds were very comfortable and good size rooms. The bathrooms were good size (lacked a little counter space, but not a big deal). You also get enough products for two people, and there is a coffee machine in the room. There is not a restaurant at the hotel, however it’s very pricy Italian restaurant next door (we did not go for breakfast), and there are a lot of breakfast options near by and also Whole Foods grocery store. It’s s great central location and I’d stay here again.

title: NY 23May23 - Mary & Djo
text: Excellent Hôtel, l'emplacement pour les longues ballades dans NY, l'équipe à votre écoute, la propreté, nous n'avons pas testé la restauration car NY à pris le relais mais tout était bien ! On a passé deux jours très agréables, on y reviens très bientôt ! Eric & Marie

title: Great hotel in convenient location
text: We've stayed at several Hyatt properties in NYC and really like the Centric Midtown for both quality of the hotel and the convenience of the location. Rooms are comfortable and quiet, staff is both welcoming and helpful, and location is convenient to transit, restaurants and venues. The on-site restaurant and rooftop lounge are both good options if you don't feel like exploring the wonderful options in the surrounding blocks or broader NYC.

title: Great hotel in a great location
text: The hotel is conveniently located in midtown. It’s small footprint and focus on service put it above the other hotels in the area. The team went out of their way to make sure I was taken care of and the breakfast service was exceptional.

title: Excellent customer service!
text: Customer service was exceptional! The receptionists and the managers helped me solve my problem (a mix-up with my reservation). Location is great. Walking distance within everything. Thank you for making my stay pleasant.

title: Impiegata del check-in maleducata
text: Per il prezzo pagato mi sarei aspettato all’arrivo il servizio bagagli poi al check-in l’impiegata non ha accettato la mia carta aziendale perché sulla carta c’è scritto Confezioni Vebi di Santucci Ughetta & C. E ho provato a spiegarle che io ero socio è in nessuna parte del mondo mi hanno fatto problemi e lei visto che mi ero alterato mi ha detto che se avessi continuato a parlare me ne sarei potuto anche andare.

title: Good Location. Great Roof Top Bar.
text:
Great Location. Food Good but Overpriced.
Marvellous Roof Top Bar view includes the Empire State building.
Staff helpful and friendly.
Room missed for make up one day but made up immediately when told.

title: 10 out of 10 would stay Again!
text: Hotel is in a great location.   Walking distance to many great places in Midtown.  Rooms are small, but that is expected for the area.  Although small the room was clean and accommodated all of our needs.  The staff, especially Janette and Anthony, were exceptional.

title: Above and Beyond
text: We were so excited when we walked into the room and saw all the surprises they had for my daughter’s birthday! They put rose petals on the bed, and even gave her snacks and a balloon! I want to thank the staff at this location, they truly went above and beyond to make my daughter feel special! I appreciate it greatly

title: Room for improvement
text:
I was not impressed by Hyatt Centric Midtown.  It did not live up to the the Hyatt standards I have grown accustomed to.  First things first, the complimentary breakfast for elite travelers is awful.  It isn’t even as good as airplane food breakfast.  There is nothing interesting on the menu.  The fruit was melon and really unripe strawberries.  The coffee was also not good.  We opted to eat out at all subsequent breakfasts.  

We were upgraded to a King suite.  It was painfully dark and oddly designed.  Not a fan of the decor.  The room darkening shades were not functional so we had to crawl onto the furniture and fix them.  We couldn’t get our room cool enough for sleeping.  There were no glasses in the bathroom for water.  The recycling bin was lined with a plastic liner.  That suggests that they do not recycle.The hanging area was open to the room like a VERY low level motel.  To turn on the shower, you had to stand in spray to get it to the right temperature.  The biggest problem of all……the rooftop bar was closed.  it was beautiful and we were able to take the steps up to the roof and enjoy the view of the Empire State Building but it was closed so we walked through a closed bar to get to the roof.  Maybe we shouldn’t have been there but it was open via the stairwell and it was delightful while we were there.

Now for the good things.  The bed was comfortable.  Housekeeping was very sweet and good.  And the best thing was a tiny light that faintly lit the toilet from the bed.  It was motion activated and very faint so you were not awakened while using the restroom in the middle of the night. 

I wish we had chosen a different Hyatt property because the price for this hotel was not reflected in the quality.  We are Hyatt loyalists so this was very disappointing.

title: Hyatt Centric 5th Avenue - Disappointing Experience
text:
As an Explorist Hyatt member, I'm beyond frustrated with my recent experience staying at this Hyatt property.  The Hyatt describes its Centric brand as:  "Upscale, cosmopolitan and highly customizable, these properties attract selective guests who want the best of what’s essential and none of what’s not — all at the center of a prime destination." I have stayed at several Hyatt properties and each time had a satisfactory experience. This however, was very disappointing for the following reasons:

1.  Reserving for 4 adults and being provided 2 sets of wash cloths, hand towels, and bath towels.  When I called to request additional supply for 4 adults, I was provided only 2 additional bath towels and 2 hand towels.

2.  Inadequate supply of in-room coffee - not enough pods with caffeine for 3 adults for one day!  The cream curdled and ruined the first cup made.  It took 3 calls and trips from staff to provide enough pods, sugar, and powder creamer for 3 adults to have coffee our first morning.  When serviced by housekeeping, still less than 3 pods of caffeinated coffee left for the room.

3.  When checking in I was not acknowledged as an Explorist.  When I asked if I would receive free water, the manager replied "We're a Centric and we don't have to give you water."  Not the friendliest explanation and not sure if that's true?

4.  Our beds were not made properly.  Upon arriving, one queen had no flat sheet and the other queen had two flat sheets - one above the fitted sheet and another on top of the comforter/duvet.  When housekeeping prepared our rooms on a subsequent day, the beds were made the same way.  Very odd!

The hotel is only 2 years old (according to staff).  There is no place in the hotel to purchase snacks or other items.  I asked for a Diet Coke and was presented with a bill of over $6 with a line to provide a tip.  

The rooftop restaurant/bar is very nice - sophisticated decor and an amazing view of the Empire State Building.

The view from our room (208) was of a concrete wall.

I'm so disappointed that I burned 50,000 points plus $1100 to stay four nights here.  If you want a great experience with a Hyatt property, choose another!

title: Hyatt stay
text: Perfect room, nice gym, great location. Very near some great restaurants and subway. Highly recommend this hotel. Great coffee shops near by. Also close to the park. Cant beat the location and access to everything.

title: Nice stay
text: I was in NYC for an event. Hyatt Centric was in an ideal location for my meeting, room was very clean and front desk team was friendly. I will stay again. I was surprised by how quiet the room was (I was on 21st floor)

title: Great stay
text: Great location and it’s fairly close to the subway and major attractions, making sightseeing convenient. Surrounding area is safe as well. Rooms are not exactly soundproof and it might affect light sleepers like myself. Bed is large and comfortable

title: Stay at Hyatt Centric NYC
text: Entire experience was excellent: from checkin, cleanliness of room, and excellent food at the restaurant. This was my fourth time to stay at the Hyatt Centric and I will definitely stay there my next trip to NYC.

title: D’accord à nos attentes. Situation géographique dans le centre facilitant les visites.
text: La vue du top est magnifique avec la possibilité de prendre un verre. Le personnel est attentif et souriant. Les chambres sont spacieuses et la literie très confortable. Possibilité de se restaurer sur place, très appréciable après une longue journée de balade

title: TOP!!!
text: Posizione strategica per muoversi sia a piedi che in metro. Personale molto disponibile e cordiale sia in sala ristorante che alla reception. Camere belle e letti molto comodi. Ristorante buonissimo sia per la colazione (a la carte, non a buffet) sia per la cena che abbiamo provato un paio di sere. Bar in terrazza una chicca per la sera, con vista sull'Empire! Lo consiglio!!!

title: Excellent Choice for Business Stay in NYC
text: Stayed here one night for its great midtown east/Bryant park location where I had work meetings.  Check in smooth, room was spacious and well appointed for NYC standards with completely renovated marble bath and useful lighting throughout room.  Great bed.  Quiet room.  Good breakfast.  Appreciated late checkout with Hyatt status.  Very nice staff encountered throughout hotel including front desk, maintenance, restaurant.  My only suggestion would be a gym upgrade—it’s fine but only one elliptical and a bit drab down there compared to other business hotels I stay in throughout Manhattan .  But I would def stay here again.

title: perfetto
text: Hotel recente e molto confortevole. La posizione è top: a pochi passi da Times Square e dall'Empire State Building . In piena midtown. Camera spaziosa per gli standard di New York così come il bagno. Tutto perfetto

title: Outstanding Customer Service Great for Business Travel or Leisure!
text: Absolutely love this hotel! I have booked a lot of properties in NY and this one bar far exceeds expectations! i had book this hotel for my two of my groups and customer service and overall experience is the best around. Thank you Adeline for being amazing and communication was super easy! She made my job easy which is hard to do so i greatly appreciate her dedication in providing exceptional customer service! This property will go above and beyond for you as they understand you have so many options to stay at in NY and take you choosing them seriously. Honestly we all can tell lately no matter where you go sometimes you do not know what kind of service you will be getting and makes us timid to spend money but i promise you will definitely feel at ease when you stay either individually or booking a group here. This will be go to hotel for NY, i wish all hotels were like this in every city!

title: Hyatt Centric
text: Staying at this hotel for a short vacation with my wife. The location is amazing and the staff very nice, helpful, and welcoming. Definitely is a place I would love to stay again when visiting New York.

title: Close to everything, nice rooms and staffs!
text: It was a nice stay, we were close to the central station to connect fast everywhere, 5th av right in the corner with public library and Brian’s park just in 2 minutes. Rooms were comfortable (has king bed! Not easy to find in NYC), nice and clean. The restaurant inside the hotel, Ramerino, has amazing food. The staff so helpful and friendly. We had a wonderful stay!

title: Amazing time at the Hyatt centric midtown.
text:
Amazing experience at this hotel. Very comfortable beds and clean rooms. The service is very fast and on time. The front desk is very welcoming and helpful with their information to the guests.
Breakfast was phenomenal the food was really good and also the staff was amazing.

title: Better than expectation
text:
I was impressed with the staff and service.
Location is amazing. Price is reasonable. They let me do a late check out and also were really helpful to keep my luggage few hours before my check in. 
Nice and clean for the money.

title: Great place to see NYC at a good price!
text: The Hyatt was clean and comfortable and was within walking distance to all the major attractions downtown!  We loved their rooftop area that showcases The Empire State Building and the lovely NYC skyline at night!  The rates are average for NYC and the service is top notch and friendly.  I highly recommend a stay here!  The rooms are clean and comfortable as well!

title: Perfect gelegen hotel in rustige straat. Goed bed, goede douche met heerlijk grote handdoeken.
text:
Kamer groot genoeg en je hebt alles wat je nodig hebt. Goed bed, goede douche, grote handdoeken. Rustige straat maar je zit overal dichtbij, we hebben bijna alles gelopen. Taxi genomen naar Lower Manhattan maar de terugweg lopend ging prima! Diner bij restaurant Ramerino is aanrader!
Je kunt daar ook goed ontbijten, reserveren vooraf was niet nodig. We hadden een relaxed verblijf hier!

title: Better than expected
text:
From a value proposition standpoint, this is a good choice.  The front desk staff upon check in were lovely and I must call out Janette for going the extra mile for a special request.

The room was nicely designed though the heating unit was quite loud and I wish I'd put in ear plugs before going to bed.

Globalist breakfast was one of the less generous ones but the staff at the restaurant were very nice.  

Anthony the General Manager was visible and hands on during my stay which was nice to see.  He was very pleasant.

I would return to and recommend this property

title: Girls weekend
text:
Hotel staff very friendly and accommodating. 
Location convenient to many area attractions.  Chose this hotel to be in a different location than my last visit. I wanted to be close to Bryant Park and Grand Central. Still easily able to walk to Times Square and Rockefeller Center. 
Wouldn’t hesitate to recommend this hotel.

title: Start spreading the news!
text: Our stay with Hyatt Centric was excellent.  We were greeted by the friendly staff when we arrived, the rooms were clean and comfortable and the location was convenient to many of the New York City attractions.  The breakfast each morning was made to order and the portion size was more than adequate.  The rooftop bar had great atmosphere and was a very relaxing place to enjoy a glass of Champagne and admire the lights of New York City. The staff was very accommodating and Katherine Rosario, the Front Office Supervisor, made sure that we enjoyed our stay.

title: A Hotel Where You Feel at Home
text:
This was my 6th stay at this hotel.  I usually stay for 5 to 6 days.  I come to New York for multiple meetings and need a hotel that is conveniently located, a nice room to work in and to rest.  This hotel has it all.  Very easy to get to the subway and many restaurants close by.  The rooms are nice, not large but large enough to work and rest and very well designed.  The staff is great.  You are welcomed warmly at the front desk.  Arlene at the front has a radiating smile and you can tell she is an example of great customer service.  The whole front desk team is great.  They welcome the guests and get them situated as quick as possible.  After a long day of meetings coming back and being greeted so nicely is refreshing.  Shannon at the front is genuinely interested in how your day was.
The hotel also has a great breakfast service.  Its usually not crowded, enough solid choices and efficient and pleasant service.  Seyma and her colleagues at the restaurant take very good care of you.
I've met the manager, Anthony a few times.  He is always helping guests and his team.  You can tell he runs the place well.
I travel around the world and for the many reasons I mentioned, I look forward to returning to this Hyatt and highly recommend it to friends.

title: Hotel was clean but breakfast less than expected
text: Restaurant was cold, we had to wear coats and food and coffee were not hot. They had one small space heater by one table near back of restaurant and services was subpar at best. For over $140 for 4 people to eat omelets and toast, the food should have been better as well as the space we ate in.

title: Another wonderful stay!
text: Stayed at the Hyatt Centric Midtown 5th Ave New York this past weekend - and had yet another wonderful stay! Room layout was perfect - very efficient, modern, clean. Staff super friendly and helpful. And the area is accessible to so many places in NYC! In short, a great place to stay when in NYC!!

title: Stylish, comfortable choice for a enjoyable stay in Midtown
text: From an easy and efficient check-in, to a friendly welcoming staff, to a quiet and cozy room, to a nice breakfast, our experience was very pleasant.  The location was excellent for our various excursions - centrally located which makes it convenient and accessible.  Decor is funky and bathroom products very nice!  Would def stay here again.

title: Clean and good location
text: Safe and well-lit area. Rooms are comfortable and have more space than a standard NYC hotel room (not just a bed between 2 walls). High quality hair dryer. Turn down service and tidying up every night.

title: Location+ / Staff++ / Room--
text: Used as base camp for another NYC dinner, show, shopping excursion. Good location a couple of blocks from Grand Central, NYC Library and Bryant Park. With the special rate I found at $175 all-in, it was a NYC bargain. Staff was top shelf and made stay warm and welcoming. The room however left much to be desired. First, space - yes, NYC small with that money-saving "open closet" for hanging clothes. But to have an overhead shelf, and but 2 drawers for storing clothes/belongings is below the Hyatt brand watermark. Better to use the "cabinet" for the ironing board which didn't fit as cubbies. Second, the bathroom - no shelving or towel bars bath meaning towels go to the floor. Oh but there is one - count it, one peg at 7 feet above the floor for a bath towel. So, the "keeping green" really means the money the laundry service makes. Now, there was a shelf under the sink vanity large enough to hold CLEAN towels and a shaving/make-up kit but little else. Third, avant garde lighting was insufficient and requires a call to front desk to understand how to operate. Fourth, seating? Fugeddaboutit. Then too, if it wasn't very clean, well kept, and again the staff, it would have rated 2-stars in spite of the savings.

title: Hyatt Centric: Exceptional in every way, and does NOT gauge NYC guests a daily “resort fee”
text:
I love this hotel for its impeccable staff who always strive to go above and beyond to ensure guests' comfort/needs are met with a smile. It is increasingly hard to find such exemplary service in this day and age, when even the most basic requests at other hotels are met with grudging mediocrity.
The interiors and rooms are clean and inviting. The mattresses are comfortable and do not have the uncomfortable dip from hundreds of previous visitors. The clean aesthetic carries on to the restaurant, which serves superb food that is fairly priced - no gauging. 
Speaking of gauging, for the past four years or so, most NYC hotels (even the substandard ones) have added a “resort fee,” -- $25 to $70 daily, on top of the listed room rate. Guests are often surprised when checking in because they only become aware of it upon check-in. It's absolutely obscene! Hyatt has never charged guests this additional fee -- ever.
The Hyatt Centric is relatively new and I've returned three times in the last year. I anticipate many more stays in the future.

title: Amazing weekend in NYC
text: New York is a limitless array of entertainment and world class restaurants. Hyatt Centric midtown is perfectly located from broadway, time square and Madison Square gardens. The exterior of the building is modern glass while the interior is colourful and trendy. The beauty of this hotel is location. The beds are comfortable and shower is great. The staff is professional and friendly. Shannon at the front desk has great advice and a warm, greeting smile every time you enter the lobby. I highly recommend the Hyatt Centric Midtown.

title: Hyatt Centric Midtown
text:
Absolutely loved our stay. 
The check-in was quick and simple. Absolutely beautiful room, clean and classy. The Italian restaurant was excellent and service was impeccable.  

Second time we have come here, and once again we were more than satisfied with our stay. 

As far as location of the hotel. It is ABSOLUTELY perfect! Minutes away from Times square, central station and subways. 

A special thanks to the general manager Mr Damiano who made our special weekend extra special, my wife and I appreciated your kind gesture.

See you guys again soon

title: Amazing location, new hotel, ideal place to stay
text: We loved this place for its convenient location to shows, sightseeing and shopping. We come to NYC every year and this will be where we stay from now on. Its new, great service, comfy beds. Recommend the rooms facing the interior. So quiet - great night sleep.  Great service, clean and comfy. Cant wait to come back

title: Another great trip to NYC
text: We returned to stay at the hotel with friends visiting the city for the first time and had a great trip. Great location as we could walk to everything we wanted to see and the staff was super friendly and helpful. Thank you, Catherine! We hope to come back again in the Spring.

title: Janky as Hell Hyatt
text:
Hyatt Elite-Discoverist here..
Sucky hotel and a disappointment from the Hyatt brand. Let's get start from the beginning.
Checked in on 1/12/23 around 3pm. The Caucasian woman working at the counter (with French/European accent) said my charge didn't go through on the room. I called to confirm with Hyatt/Chase that there was a travel lock on my card. I fixed the problem, went back to check in with her and she goes "do you have enough money to pay for the room now?"...are you kidding me?!? I have a 25k limit lol. Totally inappropriate to make any assumption and comment like that. Then they take our bags because our room isn't ready so we leave for some dinner. We call back around 5 after dinner to see if the room is ready...it's not!!! The front desk receptionist says not until 6pm! 2 hours later than check in time!
Then the night of the 15 around 8pm we call downstairs to request room service from the Italian restaurant next door....they don't even answer, followed by the receptionist saying "I don't see anyone around to take an order"...huh? 
The room itself is totally small for even NYC. Nowhere to put bags. The bathroom doors don't fully shut or lock...you can hear it all!
The rooms are noisy as hell! Constant noise from surrounding rooms and upstairs...and we were on the 18th floor! Wet condensation every morning on the window seal as well!
You might get a better deal than many Manhattan hotels, but you get what you pay for, for sure. Only redeeming quality is a good location.

title: WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE IN NY
text:
This has been the worst hotel experience I have ever had. To be honest I cannot understand how Hyatt can have a hotel in NY with that lack of client services. The employees are very disrespectful and without any education (lot of times their answers were "Yeah" - with a "I don't care about that...." tone, without even looking at us and repeating the same several times. They even hanged the phone up when my wife call to ask for them to clean the room.
The first night (December 23rd) there were lot of noise coming from other room (through the ventilation system assume). We went to sleep at 10pm and after trying to sleep without success, at 3am I went to talk with the person at the reception. I told him that I could not sleep and I wanted him to do something. The security guard (that was there too) told me that the noise was coming from 17th floor (I was on the 18th floor) and that somebody already made a complaint about them. The person in charge of the reception told me that they already asked the customers to stop making noise and they will ask again. I return to my room and at 5am I had to go again to the hotel reception to complaint about the same noises (several persons laughing and shouting loudly). The hotel employee told me that they already asked them to stop making noise. I asked him to call the police or to do something about that. He said he couldn't do anything. 
I asked him to give another room to sleep. He asked me "Now?". I replied "Yes, now. I want to sleep". He told me to return to my room that he will bring me another key for another room. Around 15/30 minutes later he brought me another key of another room. I cannot believe it was me (the client) who has ask for a clear solution (too late because I hadn't sleep in almost all night).
The other problem was that few days they did not clean the room (basic change of towels and made the bed) even if we requested that.
On Monday (Dec 26th) we left the hotel at around 11am and when we return around 5pm we found that the room wasn't cleaned at all. We called to request that to clean the room. One person (a man that was at the reception) talked with my wife and he hanged up (after saying "Yeah"...a couple of times) without giving her a clear answer. My wife called again and a woman asked her was the name of the housekeeper that was assigned to clean our room. My wife told her that we didn't know that and that was something they are supposed to know that. The same issue happened other days.

title: Conor Ryan
text: Christmas visit just your ordinary run of the mill hotel nothing stood out about it,a bit more glamorous on the website wouldn’t put anybody off staying there best thing about it was location but wouldn’t recommend it either as I a bit pricey for what it is .!!

title: Don’t go there
text:
This hotel shouldn’t be in Hyatt brand, it must be local hotel, not at level of Hyatt
Lobby is a joke
Restaurant as well
But worse are service and employees
They don’t do housekeeping for 3 days when you complain and ask them to do it they don’t care what unacceptable don’t go there

title: Great location and good service
text: It’s only 6-7mins walk to grand central station which is make it easy to go anywhere. Super close to Bryant park. Time square, central park, empire, and many other tourist spots are walkable from this hotel. The room is kinda dark but it’s pretty spacious for NY hotel size. The service is amazing. They allowed us to check in earlier and willing to hold out luggage when we check out. Water is not complimentary unless you are Hyatt elite.

title: Great location & value
text: Absolutely loved this location and the front desk staff! Will return in a couple of months! Very helpful and accommodating. Love the decor. Housekeeping made sure the room was disinfected and cleaned!

title: Sehr schönes Hotel, gute Lage
text:
Das Hotel liegt zwar etwas abseits von der nächsten U-Bahn Station „Central Station“, aber trotzdem gut zu Fuß erreichbar. Bushaltestelen sind gleich nächster Block. Zu Fuß ist zu erreichen „Time Squar; Central Station; und viele Einkaufgeschäfte“. Haben U-Bahn kaum genutzt.
Empfang sehr freundlich, man sprach auch ein paar Wörter Deutsch, zwar nicht genug für CheckIn (wir sind ja auch in der USA), es freut aber einen wenn man auf Deutsch sogar begrüßt wird. Dies hat man echt nicht erwartet. Zimmer sehr gut und bequem ausgestattet. Klimaanlage, sehr großes Bett und großes TV-Gerät. Bad sehr groß und modern, leider wie in USA oft üblich eine Badewanne. Ich mag Duschen einfach viel mehr. Blick ist nicht so besonders gewesen, aber wenn man halt von Hochhäusern umgeben ist. Es ist schon imposant, wenn man unten steht und nach oben blickt. Sehr gute Zimmerreinigung jeden Tag. WLAN ist kostenlos und sehr schnell. Kissen und Decken sehr angenehm, auf Wunsch bekommt man noch mehr.
Kann dieses Hotel echt empfehlen. Auch der CheckOut ging sehr schnell und freundlich. Wir sind mit der U-Bahn vom Flughafen angereist.

title: This is the PLACE to stay 💗
text: My families stay here was tremendous. The staff was so accommodating and welcoming! I felt right at home especially after a long day of traveling! The room was well thought out and the space was well utilized especially for NY! The location is premier as it’s only a hop and skip from the NYC Public Library, Bryant Park, shopping on 5th Ave, and Times Square/Herald’s Square. However, it’s nicely tucked away that noise isn’t a problem. This will be my new go to spot. Hyatt Centric got this one right!!

title: Christmas trip
text: Took our daughter to NY for Christmas.  Picked this hotel based off of reviews stating how close the hotel was located to things we wanted to see and how friendly and helpful the staff was.  While the first part was true, sadly the latter was not.  We arrived a little early (3:30) and they stated our room was not ready.  We asked if it would be ready at 4pm, our scheduled check-in. They stated no and said they had no idea when it would be ready, but they would call.  We had to pull out items we needed in the hotel lobby and leave our bags.  We went and ate and walked around.  They never called.  When we went back and we had to go up to the front desk three different times before we finally gained access to our room.  We also tried to get drinks from the rooftop bar located in hotel.  Was unable to drink inside because of some type of private event.  Said we could sit outside (in December mind you). We ordered drinks, bartender stated he couldn’t make change.  The bartender was very rude to us throughout this whole transaction so we decided to leave.  We would not stay at this location again or recommend.

title: Manhattan long weekend.
text: My Wife and I travelled to NYC for her Birthday to see some shows and to renew our relationship with the City. We have typically stayed at a Hyatt hotel when travelling both in Canada and various US Cities. The location of the Hyatt Centric on 38th was perfect, as we walked every day from mid town north to the Guggenheim, and south to Soho. Ideal location. The service was terrific as always, Ramarino restaurant was top of the charts,( and Sammy V is a gem!). All in all we were happy to stay. Rooms are a bit simple, but serve their purpose very well. Happy to stay again.

title: Great location for family with kids
text: We had an awesome time during our stay. An awesome hotel that was in an excellent location making everything within walking distance for the most part. Our kids loved the location. Food and everything really close by as well

title: Great location - had everything we needed!
text:
My friend and I were visiting NYC for our first time for four nights, three days in early December 2022. I booked this hotel with a pretty good deal back in April for around $375/night after taxes and fees. The hotel only opened in 2021, so everything was still in great shape. But we mainly booked it for the location. We were smack dab in between the Empire State Building and Rockefeller Center. Almost everything we wanted to do during our trip centered around our hotel, so the location was perfect. Although, after we walked about 20,000 steps our first full day - we definitely wished a subway stop was right outside the hotel doors!

We arrived at the hotel just after 6pm on Sunday evening from JFK. Our room was not ready yet and were told that it would be about 20-40 minute wait. After waiting about 10 minutes, the front desk gentleman, I believe his name was Shannon, let us know that they were actually upgrading our room which is why it was taking a long time. However, if we wanted a non-upgraded room, we could get checked in right away. We opted to wait. It took about an hour to get our room. But we got upgraded to the 19th floor when we did not choose a high floor room when booking. We had an incredible view of the Empire State Building! It was definitely worth the wait. They also gave us a voucher for a free breakfast at the hotel restaurant. We took them up on that our last day there. The breakfast was fine, but I'm glad it was free as it is definitely not worth the price! An okay bagel, egg, bacon, and cheese sandwich with a side of fruit was supposed to be around $30 I believe. Rico Bagel is like a block away and you can get an excellent bagel sandwich for $8. 

One thing I do want to say is that Shannon mentioned that we could leave our luggage with them while we waited if we wanted to go out. However, when we took them up on that offer, the area they told us to put the luggage was not secure. So we ended up just waiting in the lobby. I would definitely recommend having a secure area for luggage to be held for guests. 

The room was gorgeous. Small, but efficient. We were able to book synthetic bedding instead of feather when reserving our room, which was great. The beds were probably the most comfortable beds I've ever used in a hotel room! I also called a month before to confirm our booking and asked for a fan to be in our room. They had a nice tower fan in our room once it was ready, which made us more comfortable. 

The room was small but efficient. It had a nice mini-fridge which we definitely put to use. They don't have ice machines, but if you ask the front desk, someone will bring you some ice. That was nice our first day when nothing was cold from the fridge yet. The shower is large and beautifully decorated. However, the shower door does not secure water very well. Not the best design. But we had plenty of towels to keep the water from being a nuisance. 

We left a $5 tip for our housekeeper every day and had excellent service (tip your housekeepers!!). 

Three elevators and they are extremely fast!

We are from the upper Midwest and the last two days we were there it was 90% humidity and almost 60 degrees out.
