We looked a bit out of place with all of the New Yorkers in puffer coats - but it was hot for us! We also figured out our last night there that our thermostat had not been working the entire time. We had it set to 65 - thinking that's what it was at. But when we messed with it, we realized that it was set at 65 but it was actually 71 in there. I called the front desk and they had an engineer up to our room very quickly - even though it was really late. He had it fixed within ten minutes and for the first time since we got there, we actually had air out of our vents. We had to turn the air up to 68 as it had gotten too cold in there.  

We really had such a great experience and I would be very happy to stay there when we go back to visit!

title: Frustrating Service, Great Room!
text:
This was our first stay at a Hyatt Centric. Not entirely sure if the smaller room size was simply the NYC effect or the standard for Centrics. Even though we were upgraded to one of their bigger rooms with a balcony, the room was so small that it was hard to walk around the bed. The desk and closet were almost hidden behind the bed. We did appreciate the balcony, but it rained for most of our short stay, so we didn't get to use it as much as we would have liked. 

Upon checking in, we were told breakfast would end around 11:30. Of course, we are on vacation, so we wandered downstairs just before it ended, and were told that it closed half an hour ago. We were genuinely confused and tried to explain that the lady who checked us in told us 11:30. After going back and forth with the receptionist, we were told to go out, grab our own meal, and bring the receipt back for them to reimburse. Now, to be fair, I'm not sure there was a better way to remedy the situation, but due to having to go out and find a spot, we were quite rushed for our activities that day (nearly missed the ferry to Ellis Island). Apparently, the weekend receptionist told us weekend breakfast hours, but since this was a Sunday-Monday stay, the next day's breakfast used weekday breakfast hours. The bigger issue was more that the weekday receptionist was rather difficult to talk to and you could almost taste her anger in the air. 

Since we were in such a hurry, we were not able to take our suitcases to our next hotel (which I had planned to be on the way to the ferry), so we asked them to hold our bags for us. At the end of the day, when we returned to retrieve our bags, we were told that the receptionist had dropped his keys down the elevator shaft and our bags were locked in the storage room. He proceeded to promise to bring our bags over to our next hotel (I did not exactly trust him to do that safely, as one of our bags lost a wheel during our trip), but we had no other choice, so we left after half an hour of going back and forth. Ten minutes later, he called us back, saying he had found another way into the room. What should have been a simple minute-long process ended up becoming extremely stressful and took nearly an hour to resolve. 

These two situations are obviously probably not what you would experience during your normal stay, but I can't help but feel disappointed by the attitude of the receptionists in each situation. One was extremely belligerent and stubborn while the other was almost just nonchalant and carefree.

title: Great location!
text: This hotel is better than expected. Clean, up to date, friendly staff. The rooms are a little small and was tight for 3 people. The location and service from the staff outweigh the size of the rooms in my opinion! The rooftop bar is amazing as well as the the restaurant in the hotel. Shout out to Etma (Emma) in the rooftop bar. We made a point to go up there every night just to talk with her, grab a drink and take in the amazing views. A quick walk to Bryant Park, Times Square, 5th Ave shopping, tons of restaurants near by, you really can’t go wrong with this hotel!

title: Perfect hotel for a family visiting NYC
text: We traveled to NYC with two children, ages 8 and 5, the week of Thanksgiving. This hotel was perfect for us. We felt close to everything, yet far enough way that we didn't feel crowded and overwhelmed by Midtown. Anything we needed was steps away, yet we felt like we were on a quiet street. Within the hotel walls we were happy as well. The staff were friendly and accommodating. The room was spotless and laid out perfectly, so that it was functional for the size. We had a two queen city view room, and we felt it was really comfortable and quiet. Finally, the price was right!

title: Pictures are Misleading
text: The hotel was much smaller than the picture, the lobby was tiny and smelled of disinfectant. rooms were really dark and small.  Kind of depressing.  They were clean however.  The biggest disappointment was that despite advertising of "room service" there was none.

title: Quelques jours à NY
text:
Chambre très propre avec un mobilier et une décoration récente.  Une literie très confortable.  Le personnel est très sympathique et souriant
Seul bémol, le petit déjeuner n est pas servi sous forme de buffet, le choix est restreint et le prix élevé.

title: Bien placé, calme et non brouillant, et propre
text:
Nous avons passé un agréable séjour. Le seul hic. C’est le restaurant qui ne fait pas partie de l’hôtel qui servent le petit déjeuner. 
Ne veux vraiment pas qu’on se conforme aux exigences de personnes qui était dans la salle est à l’hôtel récemment là. Pour plusieurs jours sur place nous étions un group de 20 personnes 
A revoir pour le petit dej’ 
Pour le reste, tout était impeccable 👌

title: This hotel is a gem!
text: I can't say enough great things about this hotel.  We were within walking distance to many attractions including The New York Public Library, Rockefeller Center and  Times Square.  The staff was very accommodating and friendly.  The bed was extremely comfortable and welcoming after spending the day and night taking advantage of all NYC has to offer. This is a new hotel so everything is sparkling and modern.  The rooftop bar is an added bonus with a beautiful view of the Empire State Building, spectacular at night! I look forward to returning next year.

title: NYC Weekend Away
text: Spent a wonderful weekend in the city to see a broadway show with my Mom and two aunts. The location of the Hyatt was perfect to walk to from Grand Central Station. Close to many sights including the New York Public Library which we visited. The beds were extremely comfortable & the shower was a luxurious treat! The view from the rooftop bar & outside terrace was lovely. What a beautiful hotel! The staff was extremely helpful & attentive. Eveline was a standout! We look forward to staying here again for our next NYC visit!

title: Fantastic staff and hotel
text: The staff at the hotel are amazing and can help you with anything you need. Anthony the manger is phenomenal. Shannon at reception is such a nice person, every-time I would come back to the hotel or leave we would have a lengthy conversation about my day in the city. 10/10 would stay here again and will be staying with them again in the near future.

title: Can't go wrong here
text:
Perfect location, good size bathroom for NYC, room is clean & quiet. Bed was very good. Only complaint and its minor is the bed is lower than knee height off the floor.
I read too many reviews trying to figure out the best option, this is a solid choice. Pricey but its NY.

title: Great Midtown experience!
text: Hyatt Centric Midtown was centrally located in Manhattan, with great coffee shops and breakfast nearby.  I recommend Gregory's for a good cup of coffee.  We did not get breakfast at the hotel, as it was too expensive.  Our room was clean, modern and quiet.  Very kind and helpful staff as well!

title: Great staff
text: Stayed for one night, room was bigger than expected and staff was friendly. My light was broken in my room, but staff fixed it immediately and were very helpful about it. Overall great experience and would stay again.

title: PARFAIT
text:
Choisi suite à une promotion sur voyage privé de 40% et ce pour la première fois nous avons passé un séjour exceptionnel dans cet hôtel. 
Situation parfaite.
Personnel accueillant et serviable 
Propreté irréprochable  ménage journalier, chambre spacieuse lit kingsize. 
Produits d'accueil de qualité et réapprovisionné tous les jours  idem pour la machine à café. 
Frigo et coffre fort.
Des couloirs silencieux et bonne insonorisation des chambres.  salle de douche et WC séparés, penderie et tiroirs de rangement. 
3 ascenseurs aucune attente.
Un bar rooftop de folie avec vue sur l'Empire State
Restaurant italien dans l'hotel. Prix un peu cher mais de qualité 
Seul bémol le petit déjeuner est trop cher dans sa formule .
Nb nous avions une chambre sur cour...pas de vue mais pas de bruit et à  New York c'est mieux.

title: Love this hotel!
text: We had a great stay. The hotel location is perfect. Round the corner from beautiful Bryant park and the NY Public Library. We took a short stroll to the 34street ferry and sailed over to dumbo in no time which I thoroughly recommend. Most things are walkable from here. We had really good sized, well equipped room with a very comfortable bed. The addition of somewhere to hang a towel of robe would be handy. All staff were wonderful and attentive. Arlene in particular gave us great service. It was my first trip to NY from the UK and I hope to stay at the Hyatt midtown 5th Av on my next trip.

title: Nice hotel, 3 stars for recent stay but would try it again.
text: Stayed at the Hyatt last weekend for 3 nights. Had issues with the air con, reception were absolutely useless and engineering were a no show but have since had the manager reach out and assured me that this was a unique issue. Hotel room was otherwise very comfortable and great location. Will give this hotel one last try on next trip as location was ideal and bed was comfortable but I won’t be as forgiving if the air con issue was not unique to this past trip.

title: 2 nights in a great location
text: Overall a solid, centrally located hotel. Clean room, good water pressure in the shower, comfortable bed. The room got cool from the AC, but never really got to feeling like it was actually at the temperature listed. It takes a minute to get used to the light fixtures and automatic lights on the bed. No closet, but there are places to hang clothes. Keurig in room. Would stay again.

title: Excellent hotel mid town Manhattan
text: Good location.  Rooms and bathroom were clean and fresh and room staff kept up well.  Very good Italian restaurant on site as well as breakfast.  Staff for both were excellent.  Roof top bar was closed which was a bit disappointing.

title: Boutique new alternative
text:
This is a good alternative near Grand Central. A bit of a smaller hotel feel with decent sized rooms that are nice and new. It is quite new still so the rooftop wasn't open yet.

Pros
- location convenient. Close to GC without being right on the doorsteps and dealing with the traffic there
- nice new rooms
- not a huge amount of thoroughfare

Cons
- air conditioning was super noisy, so beware light sleepers
- restaurant was expensive for breakfast. Seek other options nearby
- boutique in size but didn't have a personalized feel to it. But can't complain for a business trip.

title: Meh
text:
AC didn’t work, maintenance came but never got above 75 degrees in the room for two days. 
Hotel was sold out (wedding nearby), breakfast kitchen only had one cook. Our food took a hour to come out. 
Rooms were small but it’s NYC. Nicely renovated rooms and spacious, beautiful shower.

title: Great location, friendly staff
text:
Loved the location, central and close to good subway stops and grand central station. 
Staff were lovely. 
Breakfast was so nice - cooked to order and well worth it. Breakfast staff were so friendly. 
Initially given an inward facing which I really didn’t like, they kindly changed it.

title: Not upt to Hyatt Standard
text: Location is fine, property is average, i would a different Hyatt property next time. The room was small, dark, sparse, no closet, seems like the Hyatt was trying to cut corners every strep of the way when it comes to the room.

title: NYC Weekend getaway
text:
Perfect location for our weekend trip to NYC. We wanted a central location that was easy to get to and we were able to explore. Our Main reason for this trip was to go to a concert at Yankee Stadium. Loved that we were close to the train we needed to take to the stadium. 

The hotel was clean. The room are NY rooms not too much space but still were comfy and perfect for the weekend. 

The only reason I didn’t give 5 star is because it doesn’t provide parking. There’s a few garage near so finding parking wasn’t a problem but would be nice if they had parking. 

Staff were friendly and attentive. Definitely will be in our NYC hotels rotation.

title: decent room, decent price, great staff
text: great location, decent stay for the price point, did not like the color of the rooms, too dark and not airy enough, would not stay in this hotel again without a paint lift, staff was friendly, restaurant was below par

title: We had Some Problems, but....
text: ...we'd definitely give this hotel another try simply based on the great customer service offered by Greg, the assistant GM, Chantell, Arlene and all the wonderful employees we encountered during our stay. That is the reason we gave it 4 stars. As a Globalist, we had been upgraded to a suite and the room itself was extremely clean and comfortable enough from a size standpoint, except we had a problem with the air conditioning, which made for 2 very uncomfortable evenings.  The other concern was the lighting, which is inadequate, especially considering the dark green color scheme and the eclectic design.  But, the hotel was very quiet for NYC, the bed was comfortable, the shower pressure was excellent and breakfast in the restaurant was delicious.  Plus, you can't beat the location and the price for midtown Manhattan. All reason's why we'd give this hotel another try and recommend to our friends and family (assuming the air conditioning problem we encountered was an anomaly and not the norm since I don't see this issue in other reviews).

title: Buen hotel y muy céntrico
text:
Me hospede ahí con mis hijos y mi esposo en diciembre de 2021, es un hotel muy limpio y cómodo y está muy bien ubicado, está a pocas cuadras de una estación de metro y caminando puedes llegar a Bryant Park, es un hotel familiar y de negocios, por lo que si te molesta el ruido es muy buena opción .
El personal es amable, sobre todo la persona que estaba en front desk de nombre Michael, siempre sonriente y tratando de consentir a los niños y hacerles platica! Es un hotel al que sin duda regresaría, ya sea en familia o en plan de negocios.

title: Outstanding Customer Service at the Hyatt Centric on 5th Ave.
text: On a recent business trip to nyc I had to make a last minute hotel change which landed in at the Hyatt Centric Midtown. I usually stay at a Hilton, but they lost my reservation and were not at all accommodating.  I was not a happy camper and was tired from the flight. I stopped by the Hyatt and talked to the front desk individual- I explained I had no reservation and was told ‘no problem sir we have a room with your name on it .. one just for you’…. with a big smile!! (I thought for a moment I was Twilight Zone). I travel frequently and I have to say, that Edil (the front desk individual) was a breath of fresh air. I was treated like their most important customer (you know the highest rewards tier). I was not really familiar with the immediate area and was tire and hungry. Edil quickly got me checked in and suggested a few places to eat in the area and where the closest Starbucks was… he also let me know when they closed !! I had questions about transportation and a few other items and Edil was more than helpful. His demeanor, attitude, and friendliness was a tremendous departure of what I’m use to at other hotels. To top it off, once I got settled in my room , he called to make sure I was happy with the room.  This has not been my experience at other hotels at all. I will certainly return and will let my office staff and travel department know of the exemplary service I received. Thank you Edil and the Hyatt Centric for a wonderful stay.  I shall return.

title: Charming little hotel
text: It’s a great location and a nicely appointed hotel with some unusual (but good) lighting features in the rooms. Of course it’s small — it’s a NYC hotel — but the rooms make the best use of the space and they don’t feel small. Didn’t try the restaurant or café but they smelled good. Fitness room was perfectly acceptable— nothing special but it did the job. Very friendly staff.

title: Glamorous, Comfortable, Spacious, Affordable Hotel With High Quality & Service
text: Clean, spacious, stylish, fresh, accommodating and affordable—what a hotel!  Quiet, great value for price, this place is beyond nearby competitors. Housekeeping, front desk and in house restaurant are all beyond expectations and highly competitive quality.

title: Great value in NYC
text: Fabulous location. Great staff service. Clean rooms. Elegant design. Friend and professional staff. Great for personal requests and highly adaptable. Ok breakfast, yet ready to adjust to personal asks. For views above 18th floor, amazing view. Thank you to the staff.

title: Great Location, Amazing Staff
text: From the minute I arrived, the staff at the Hyatt Centric Midtown 5th Avenue New York were wonderful -- friendly, helpful, professional.  The location is both completely central to midtown Manhattan and easy to get to all parts of the city.  And although right in the most convenient location it was not noisy.  The restaurant I don't think served breakfast but there are plenty of coffee, breakfast, lunch and dinner places in every direction (although NYC prices).

title: Great service, clean efficient rooms and a restaurant/bar that feels like walking into a dream!!!!
text: Great hotel.  Love the HYATT Centrics, but this one is well done.  Great service, clean rooms, perfect location, and, the restaurant and bar are just over the top - food, service, value, and atmosphere!!!  All sooo good!!!

title: Super clean room and friendly staff
text: Room was super clean. We were on 17th floor. There is no view from room though it was higher-floor. Staff were friendly and helpful. Small room for the price, but I guess that is expected in New York. Overall it was a stress free stay for us.

title: OK MAIS SANS PLUS
text: je suis arrivés malade a l hotel .D habitude si on me donne une chambre comme ca,je ne l aurais jamais acceptée, mais la n etant pas en forme ....je me suis laissé pigeonner .Chambre reçue avec vue sur un mur ....aller jusqu a New York pour ca est quand meme fort dommage .Odeur dans la salle de bain .le problème de la salle de bain a été réglé après 24h.Apres m être plein au responsable de l hotel , il m a promis que lors de mon prochain séjour a New York je ne serais pas déçu si je lui envoyais un email.Moi je lui avais plutôt demandé une reduction sur le séjour qui n a d'ailleurs pas abouti .retournant a New York ,je lu ai écrit un email qui est resté sans réponse .......bref meme s il devait me répondre son hotel ne casse rien , il y a mieux pour le prix .A oublier

title: Beautiful hotel in heart of New York!
text: Loved our stay at this hotel, friendly staff, very welcoming. Well thought out rooms - great design. With a great restaurant with phenomenal food. Well located - definitely will be coming back! Thank-you for making it amazing

title: Very nice hotel & amazing location!
text:
Staff is out going and very friendly! From the time we arrived till the time we checked out, we all felt very welcomed! Rooms are very clean, very comfortable and well thought of, love the design. 
You can tell every detail matters! Loved our stay and would definitely go back! Thank-you for making it so wonderful!

title: Hôtel calme, Situation géographique ++
text: Hôtel super bien situé à 3mn de marche de la grande bibliothèque et de Bryant Park, moins de 10mn de Times Square et de l’ESB, idem Grand Central. Personnel très sympa, ménage fait TLJ, à la fois proche de tout et très calme pour bien se reposer après des grosses journées de visites.

title: Great Hotel
text:
This is a great hotel. 
It is clean and close to everything.  
Nice new room with lots of USB chargers, an open style closet, bench, mini fridge, desk and chair. The mini fridge came in handy as we bought water to keep fresh which were needed for the HOT weather we experienced during our stay. The bathroom is nice, especially the shower  Overall the room was clean and chic.
The staff was extremely friendly and always went out of their way to say Good Morning or Good Evening and answer any questions we had.
We would definitely stay here again.

title: Decent but not great
text: Very good location. Friendly staff. Property was clean and comfortable but very basic. I would suppose about in line with the price. Rooms were small and had a few technical issues while staying there.

title: Very Nice Stay!
text:
Very much enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Centric! 

The staff was all super friendly, including responding to a few custom requests. 
Our room was nice and clean. Fast elevators that weren't busy.  AC worked well. Modern shower. Blackout curtains kept the room dark. 

Great location too near Bryant Park, as we had easy access to many Subway lines. 
One thing to note is the hotel barely has any lobby (only a small sitting area). This fact had no impact on our stay but I suppose some others may value having more of a lobby for lounging.

title: Pretty good location, chic room
text:
Chose this hotel to be a little bit away from the busiest areas but still populated. This hotel is around the corner from the NY Library, close to Bryant Park, a few minutes walk from Grand Central station. Easy to catch trains from here uptown to museums. Plan on 15-20 minute walk to theater area. The hotel area was very quiet late on Sunday night so i took a cab back to it instead of walking—but mostly it seems to be pretty safe to walk in the area surrounding this hotel. Easy to catch cab on the busier streets on either side of hotel. 

Nice updated room with a lower king sized bed, lots of lighting options, USB chargers, an open style closet with iron and ironing board for biz travelers, bench to put your suitcase or sit and put your shoes, a desk, mini fridge, and chair. I didn’t have a chance to turn on the tv. Bath is nicely updated though the shower floor is a bit slippery and there’s not a lot of counter space. Overall the room was clean, very chic and stylishly updated, but the view from my room faced the other buildings, haha! 

Lobby was nice, staff are friendly and helpful. Restaurant below was noisy when in the lobby but I couldn’t hear it on the 8th floor. 

This room would be good for a solo traveler or a couple. 

I normally like to stay in boutique hotels, especially in NYC, but this was a good value and Hyatt offered flexible cancellation if needed. Would consider staying here again!

title: Super hotel, amazing location, appropriate pricing
text:
I Really enjoyed this boutique hotel. It was very comfortable and modern. Couldn't ask for a better location for visiting both downtown and uptown. I had an amazing view. 

Heads up that there's no signage on the door, so it can be tricky to find if you don't see the name on front of the hotel

title: Weekend getaway
text: Convenient location to all of the popular touristy sites including Times Square; friendly and professional staff; spacious and clean guest rooms compared to other NYC hotels (with a fridge); definitely worth a return stay during our next trip.

title: Great hotel, great location, great night front desk staff
text:
The hotel is in an excellent location, within walking distance of all the major attractions. 

Some of the front desk staff were ok (but some were less than helpful). However, we received OUTSTANDING service from Shannon Owens and his manager Gregory Velo - both of these gentlemen made our stay so much more comfortable and enjoyable, and we cannot thank them enough! 

We would recommend staying at this hotel for the excellent service provided by Shannon and Greg, and for the great location.

title: AWFUL customer service. Beware before you book!
text: Very rude front desk staff (Arlene), I have never experienced a nastier check-in person for no reason at all. I realize it's hard to find employees, but Hyatt should be ashamed to have people like this working. Reported incident to Jasmine (manager) and my complaint fell on deaf ears. Wound up leaving the hotel. This hotel has ZERO customer service.

title: Great Location and Staff
text: The location is perfect! Right in the middle of Midtown next to Bryant Park. The staff is extremely nice and will help you with whatever it is you need. They were very welcoming to our kids too. Rooms were always clean with great showers and comfortable beds.

title: Gutes Hotel für einen Städtetrip
text:
Wir waren zu Besuch in diesem Hotel für einen Städtetrip in NY.
Die Lage des Hotels ist sehr gut. Man ist schnell bei der UBahn und den Sehenswürdigkeiten.
Die Fenster sind sehr schlecht isoliert, weshalb man den Strassenverkehr sehr gut hört im der Nacht. Falls man einen leichten Schlaf hat, ist das Hotel nicht gut.
Alles in allem ein gutes Hotel für ein paar Nächte. Preis/Leistung stimmt.

title: Another GREAT experience
text: Just completed our 4th stay at the Hyatt Centric Midtown 5th Ave New York. Each time, we have had a great experience! Staff is very friendly, efficient, accommodating. Rooms are well appointed, comfortable and designed to maximize available space. Midtown location allows for so many dining options - from casual to upscale. All in all, a great choice for a NYC stay.... just cannot wait for the Rooftop Bar to open up!

title: The best hotel in NYC!!
text: The whole staff, from the front desk to housecleaning and everyone in between, were incredibly professional, kind, courteous and always willing to help with a huge smile! My boyfriend and I will definitely go back and would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone!! We really cannot thank you enough for making our stay such a memorable one! 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

title: New, clean, quiet rooms - close to everything midtown - great price for this area
text: This is my 5th trip to NYC. We wanted to stay just outside of Midtown because we haven't enjoyed the hotels in that area in the past. This location is great (Murray Hill). So close to Bryant Park and NYC Library and Grand Central Station. Short walk to Empire State building, Rockefeller Center, Theater District. I booked directly with the hotel and the staff member who helped us was so amazing. He even called back to make sure our reservation came through okay. The best part was how quiet the rooms were. New, clean, modern furnishings and comfortable, firm bed that was excellent for my husband's bad back. Clean, quiet, safe, no frills. Great place to sleep at end of long day in the city. A good deal - other hotels in this area are more expensive.

title: Very Clean, Super Friendly staff
text: The staff was so friendly and personable. Rooms were very clean, well kept and modern.  Located close to Penn Station and Times Square and everything you want to see , but off the main strip to be nice and quiet too. Housekeeping was so helpful and kept the room clean and stocked. Bed was super comfy.

title: Few days in New York
text:
We stayed here with a group of friends and family in for a wedding. Location was brilliant. So central for restaurants and shows and we walked to high line also ( if you like walking). 
Rooms were small but comfortable and clean.

title: New York City Visit
text:
The location was ideal for touring NYC, dining out and attending plays on Broadway.
The rooms are modern fresh and updated with the latest energy efficient lights. Infact, my wife particularly liked the automatic floor lights located on the base of the beds.
Most importantly, the staff was friendly and helpful.

title: Pleasant Stay
text: The hotel staff was very friendly. The room and bathroom was very clean. The hotel location is great. Very close to Bryant Park and nearby restaurants. So far my favorite hotel in midtown. Highly recommended!!

title: A Redemption visit
text: My last trip to the hotel left quite a bit to be desired in terms of the customer service. I reached out to the GM prior to this trip, shared my concerns, many of which he was aware of and had already corrected. He assured me that this visit would be very different and he was absolutely right, as you can see by my rating. The only thing I would ask them to consider (which they are) is to allow Globalists access to the entire breakfast menu, and to work out a system where meals and drinks can be charged to the room. However, the team from front desk, to housekeeping, to the restaurant, were all amazing! And the location is perfect.

title: Great midtown location!
text:
This hotel is in such a great location! 

You'll read this consistently in many reviews and I'll say it again!  It's removed from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and other popular midtown hotspots, but close enough to walk to them. Also, it's a short walk to many subway stations. 

While we initially thought we'd be visiting central park a lot during our trip, we ended up spending many of our evenings at Bryant park, which is a just a few blocks from the hotel. While much smaller compared to central park, this park feels a lot more activated, especially in the evening. There are movie and yoga nights on the lawn. There are games such as ping pong too!

As far as the hotel goes, it feels like a like new or recently renovated property. The rooms are good size and efficient. They service the rooms each day, which is refreshing nowadays.  The room does run a bit warm, however, you can ask for a floor fan.  They are super responsive to service requests. For example, my shower wasn't draining very well. They were knocking on my door to fix within 30 seconds after hanging up the phone. I know it's a small hotel but still very impressive. 

The gym is a good size and never seemed full. 

We only had breakfast one day there. It's a good breakfast with your typical offerings, but it is rather pricey. To give you an idea: our order of pancakes, oatmeal, American breakfast with coffee and OJ came out to $80 after tip.  Don't get me wrong, it was tasty. But maybe not an affordable daily option. 

Lastly, the rooftop bar is not yet available for this property. 

Overall, great Hyatt property! Highly recommend if visiting NYC.

title: Clean, comfortable and convenient stay
text: The room was great, spacious, modern and clean. We really appreciated the modern and udated room, it makes for a comfortable sleep after a long day exploring the city. The price was reasonable, considering the room, and location in midtown NYC. Staff was corteous and helpful.

title: Very good for the price
text: Overall a good hotel option in a great location. Rooms are nicely appointed and spacious, but the one I was assigned on the second floor had very little natural light reaching it and the wifi performance was poor. However, this is a better than average hotel by NYC “affordable” standards and I would not hesitate to select this hotel again if the rate is under $250.

title: Well located in Midtown
text: The hotel is amazing. It is located near the 5th avenue - 10min walk from Times Square. The room was big enough for a Manhattan hotel and the staff was very friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay in this hotel again next time we come to New York.

title: Very nice stay !
text:
We had a very good experience staying at the Hyatt Centric Midtown 5th avenue. The hotel is lovely, so is the staff. The room looked like the pictures on the website and was beautiful ! Bed was huge and very comfy. There is a safe and a mini fridge in the room. Cleaning was done everyday, no need to ask the front desk. They keep the luggage for free on the last day and no extra fees like you can find in a lot of hotels in NYC. Close to Bryant Park and Times Square. I definitely recommend ! 

(Ps : we didn’t need to use the AC a lot but it may be a bit loud during summer when it’s on)

title: Great hotel and amazing location!
text:
Had a amazing stay at the Hyatt centric. The location was splendid (just two minutes from the public library), and the room was great in size and clean. The bedroom also had large windows which gave plenty of light.
Would definitely be coming back for my next New York trip!

title: Great hotel
text: Hotel was nice, clean and convenient.  Staff were very friendly and helpful.  Everything is a short walk or cab ride away, allows a break from the noise of times square hotels without being too far away.

title: Disappointed,
text: If you want to stay in an upscale hostel ok but if not don’t stay here. From the narrow hall ways to get to your room , to the tight accommodations it was an utter  disappointment . No we’re to put your luggage, you have to request ice, room service comes at 9am and the list goes on

title: Great hotel
text: I enjoyed my stay here.  The room was a good size, the shower was the best I've had at any hotel.  Comfortable beds and pillows.  We were on 5th floor and it was pretty quiet.  Managed to sleep good.  Its just across the road from Bryant Park and close to Times Square, Grand Central Station and subways.  The staff were really nice and helpful.  Would book this hotel again if we come to NY.

title: Hyatt Centric Midtown nails the luxury-on-a-budget/design-centric vibe
text: Since moving out of NYC four years ago (but still coming into the city often for work), I've sampled many of the new hotel brands catering to a younger/more budget conscious traveller, but still trying to provide a cool, design-centric vibe. This one is the best I've found. Unlike many competitors, the smart and compact room design still feels large and luxurious; the bathroom/shower is fantastic (and not in the middle of the room!); the bed is comfy-amazing; the exposed closet actually has hanging space for your work clothes. Smart touches, like motion-sensor nightlights around the bed and tinted windows, add luxe without adding $$$. The in-room desk and chair provide a comfortable place you can actually work for many hours a day, if you need to. The staff is outstanding, and the breakfast restaurant is open until 11:30 AM, something I really appreciate on a long work stay! Bravo Hyatt Centric!

title: New Hotel Smell
text:
Conveniently located in Midtown Manhattan and close to multiple subway lines, so a great starting point for those looking to explore the city. The area gets a little quiet and deserted at night but felt safe the whole time.

The lobby was small but efficient. The front desk staff were prompt and professional. I believe there's a restaurant in the back, but it wasn't open when I stayed, so they explained that I could order food through a third party. That was a nice alternative.

Stayed in a room with a city view and you know it was a new hotel when the room still had that "new" smell. Looking out the window there were some building water towers and the Empire State Building in the distance. A pretty NYC view if you ask me! The room was on the small side (though in NYC, this is standard), but it was still big enough to fit a little table and extra seat in there on the side. The bed was a bit on the hard side but still comfy.

Overall had a good short stay here.

title: Exceptional customer service and the perfect location. Very safe!
text:
The hotel is located in a prime location close to time square,
Central Park and some excellent restaurants. The customer service here was outstanding. The staff was always willing to help and constantly asked about our experience throughout the stay. The breakfast was terrific. The hotel was clean. The staff is presentable and professional. Thank you all for a wonderful visit.

title: Mrs
text: Excellent staff,their GM Antony lends a personal touch to ensure every guest is taken care & happy.He helped us beyond words & expectation with our luggage.Their front desk staff Rochelle, Yesenia, Evelin, Jasmine, Arlene and Vernon,is very pleasant ,bell boy Jose is super helpful .Lucy & Andy are very efficient in serving hot  breakfast.We extended our stay at the hotel due to the warmth & personal touch & we expect to come back.God bless each one of you.Thank you Hyatt staff

title: Great Place!
text: This is a nice, clean and convenient hotel. Really new and exceeded expectations. Room was nice size with great amenities. Nothing Beats the Hyatt Bed and Pillows. Staff was nice and I enjoyed the quiet atmosphere.

title: Beautiful, Clean Room with only one con
text:
Pros: The location is fantastic. I loved waking up in the morning and being a few minutes stroll from Bryant Park with of the food/coffee options nearby, as well a super short walking distance to the New York Public Library and shopping on 5th avenue. The room and bathroom were immaculate. Everything was modern, new, and pristine, and the beds were comfortable. I booked a double room and had 2 queen beds and quite a large room by NYC standards.

The con: The street noise was unbearable. No one in my room slept. We were on the 8th floor, overlooking 39th street, and we heard the sirens, the traffic, the garbage/recycling, dumpsters being dropped that sounded like bombs going off, two men fighting in the street, etc. There was zero soundproofing. The beds were very comfortable and I really wish we could have gotten some sleep but I felt like we were trying to sleep in the middle of the street it was so loud. 

Would I stay here again? Absolutely, IF and only if I could get a room on a higher floor and on the other side of the building where hopefully it is a little quieter.

title: Up to the Brand Standard
text: Hyatt Centric Midtown 5th Ave is our hotel of choice when we are in NYC for business. It's centrally located and the rooms are spacious (for Manhattan standards), they are clean and comfortable. The entire staff is courteous and acclimating when possible.

title: A good hotel near Time Square
text:
Pros: Clean,with new linen and towels, ample of soap and shampoo, quiet at night, free wifi.
Cons: procey ($500/night) , small room, no free breakfast and parking. No free water bottles in the room. No other aminities such as swimming pool, Spa, parking garage.

title: Great, Functional Hotel in a Convenient Area
text: Very clean, well organized, very functional hotel. Excellent staff. Great gym. Lots of quick food nearby. The staff brought a glass to my room in 2 minutes, delivered takeout to my room - it's the little things that count when you're on the road. Definitely recommend for a business traveler. Rooms are small but it's NYC. Wasn't disappointed about that.

title: Volvería sin dudarlo
text: Estuvimos 9 dias.Cumplió ampliamente con nuestras expectativas. Excelente ubicación, atención muy cordial, habitaciones cómodas y modernas. Las mismas cuentan con mini refrigerador y máquina de café con cápsulas de cortesía. Al ser un hotel pequeño, el movimiento de gente es mínimo y uno se siente como en casa.

title: Great location 👍🏻
text: Nice, clean hotel that has great location: walking distance to 5th avenue and Madison avenue. The tourist areas are close by- Bryant Park, Ny Public Library, Empire State Building, Grand Central Terminal, Rockefeller Center also. We love Korean food, and Ktown isn’t so far away either. The rooms are not huge but cozy. We had 2 queen beds, a large tv, small closet space, refrigerator and a safe. The bathroom needs more hooks to hang towels. The area is busy but not too loud- although you can hear trucks and such in the mornings. Breakfast was reasonable, omelet, hash, croissant and 2 coffees = $34.  The hotel also welcomed us with some prosecco, so that was nice. It rained one time and we were able to use the onsite Rentbrella where we rented umbrellas free for 24 hours. Great spot!

title: excellent location, super clean small efficient rooms with all amenities
text: Locate on 39th St. between 5th Avenue and Madison Ave, this brand new hotel features small rooms (with king size beds), a desk, open closet (no doors to save space, a chair and footstool, large screen TV, safe and mini-fridge, and a spacious bathroom.  While the room is the size of a cruise ship cabin, it's efficient and certainly reasonably priced.  The bathroom needs a towel bar and a small shelf but maybe they will put it in after reading this review .  A rooftop bar is scheduled to open in June so we didn't see that unfortunately.   Breakfast is delicious and features everything you could want, with prices reasonable for the area (figure $25 - $30 p,p. for a full breakfast with coffee).  Dinner is available and on our last night we took advantage since we didn't want to deal with the rain outside.  Food was good, nothing special but hearty and tasty and again, pricing is reasonable.  The front desk people were top notch, there to help in every way.  Daily cleaning to your specifications are offered, so if you only want towels, and refreshed toiletries, that is what you get; if you want full service, you can get that.  Very comfortable hotel for a short stay in the Big Apple. I'm adding this as it's asking me if there is Covid testing on site.  I didn't ask, but there are Covid testing sites on every street right now in NYC.

title: A great, affordable place to stay in Manhattan
text: We were really happy with our stay here. The staff were friendly and efficient. The room was a decent size (especially by NYC standards). It's a very new hotel, but not sterile. The location is very convenient--good for tourist visits and likely to be convenient for business travelers. The rates, for a Manhattan hotel, were reasonable. NOTE: The bed was incredibly comfortable. Maybe that's just me--I realize "comfortable" is subjective--but I wished I could have taken the bed home with me. (I couldn't).

title: Plan to Return!
text: We're glad we stayed here. Great location just off Fifth Avenue, within a short distance from Grand Central and even the theater district. The staff couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. Our room was relatively small, but well designed, and we heard no street noise, so it was nice and quiet. The next time we go to New York, we will check for rooms in this hotel first.

title: Superb property. Superb experience.
text: An amazing property located in the heart of midtown. The staff was amazing. Make sure Michael checks you in. His hospitality and attention to detail was incredible. I was genuinely welcomed each time I walked into the hotel. From Housekeeping to the Director of Operations, the staff was the absolute finest.

title: Great booking experience!
text: Loved coordinating and working with the team at the Hyatt! They were so responsive and helpful. It was a clear process booking for a very large group and we had little to no complaints about everyone's stay

title: Great location GREAT STAFF :)
text: Easy check in. Staff at front desk was super nice and answered all my questions. Cleaning crew was funny and so great to see in the mornings. They had all great recommendations for exploring NYC. Thank you :)

title: Overnight stay
text: The hotel was great for our one-night stay.  Also, the staff was very helpful.  One staff member even showed us how to use an app for an umbrella.  Also, breakfast was very good, and the service at breakfast was  pleasant. We would go back to this hotel for another visit to NYC.

title: Decent place to stay in Midtown Manhattan
text: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in late April 2022 with adult relatives, sharing two rooms.  Never sure how to rate "value" for a NYC hotel. Newly remodeled - rooms are very sleek, pleasant; not huge (had a regular double queen and a king room). A few frustrations - lighting wasn't the best; no place to hang towels (even though you're encouraged bypass housekeeping service until the 3rd day). Housekeeping took items (partially eaten bags of chips and nuts; empty water bottle) as "trash" that we were not done with and that were NOT in the trash - even after we complained about it. It was noisy due to some kind of construction taking place all night across the street - but I doubt there are very few places in NYC where you can avoid this - not the fault of the hotel.  On the plus side: great location - just a few blocks from NYC Public Library and Grand Central station. Smaller hotel, so no long wait for the elevators, nor for front desk staff when checking in or out. Front desk and housekeeping staff were very friendly and responsive when we asked for additional towels and coffee. Depending on the price, I would definitely consider staying there again. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant due to prices.

title: Great location in the Big Apple.
text: Had a great weekend stay at The Hyatt Centric 5th Ave in New York City.  Rooms are large and spotlessly clean.  The staff is very helpful and accommodating.  Their little restaurant serves a tasty and satisfying breakfast.  My only complaint is that the coffee in the room was pretty anemic.  That's a small inconvenience for such a wonderful stay.  Will definitely return!

title: Lovely stay
text: My daughter and I really enjoyed our stay at this Hyatt Centric location. It was my daughter’s first time in NY and our room was just what we needed. The staff, including housekeeping, was absolutely amazing. Very welcoming and helpful. The beds were comfortable, roomy shower and good breakfast on site. Walking distance to Grand Central and Times Square.  We look forward to returning again.

title: Great location and great service!
text: This location is tucked away, but close to 5th Ave. and has the best rooms to keep your nights lively and your late mornings cozy for extra sleep!  The rooms are beautifully decorated, comfy, and far enough way from the major traffic to let you sleep with the blackout shades.  The staff is very welcoming.

title: Great location and value
text: This is starting to become my go to hotel for business trips to NYC.  Location is great.  Close enough to walk to the busy touristy areas and far enough away to not get stuck in that traffic.  Easy to catch an uber or walk to a train station.  Hotel feels new.  Rooms are small, but most hotel rooms in NYC are going to be small.  While small the rooms are functional, clean, and sufficient.  Staff is amazing at all levels from front desk, to housekeeping, to breakfast staff.  Hyatt Globalists are treated very well.  Strongly recommend.

title: Couldn’t fault anything
text: Hotel was really reasonably priced. Great location, good amenities, hotel room was clean and with nice decor. The staff were super helpful form the day we arrived - especially the front desk and concierge. The team really looked after us and helped us at every opportunity. The rooms were always made up to a high standard too so also a credit to the maid service. We were room only so never ate in the hotel but we couldn’t fault anything about our experience here. Thank you Hyatt Centric for a lovely experience for our first time in NY!

title: Great Hotel with amazing staff
text: This is the first time I stayed at this Hyatt.  The room and amenities were very clean.  The hotel staff (everyone of that I encountered) was friendly and went out of their way to see if I had any questions.  I really appreciated the service.

title: Cozy, great location, amazing service.
text: If you like midtown there is no better than Hyatt Centric 39&5th. The area is great! Close to everything without being in the middle of the craziness. You get the benefits of a Hyatt brand with a signature hotel.

title: A lovely boutique-style hotel in the heart of midtown
text: We had a truly lovely time at the Hyatt Centric Midtown.  From the moment we entered the hotel, Rochelle, Jose, and all the other staff could not have been more responsive or accommodating.  The location was excellent for the theater district and exploring midtown, and our room, although on the smaller side, fit our needs well.  Our only suggestion would be to add more closet/drawer spaces for travelers on longer stays.  Would definitely recommend.

title: Small but stylish. Clean and comfortable.
text: The hotel is conveniently located in midtown, with a welcoming lobby and staff.  The rooms are recently remodeled and very functional with many places to plug in.  Bathroom is very nicely done and functional - particularly liked that you can start the shower without getting in. The room is small however. As a single person it was fine.  Two would work but certainly no more than that. I will go back if the rates are competitive.

title: Family vacation
text: We stayed at this hotel for a couple of days and we had an excellent experience here. Rooms were very clean, staff was very friendly and ready to help with everything we needed. The restaurant was excellent and breakfast was delicious. Would strongly recommend it. We will definitely go back again.

title: For Joni and Alba, thanks
text:
I have visited many hotels around the world, but none with such kind and special attention.  In this hotel the attention is 10/10.  All the staff is very attentive and they will always want to help you in everything you want.  The rooms have very comfortable beds and very complete bathrooms, including a hair dryer and shampoo and conditioner.

 But I am especially writing this review because of the wonderful and wonderful dinner that my mother and I had tonight.  We sat down and ordered a masala for dinner and were served by an attentive and very caring guy called Joni, he made us have a lovely evening.  We also met the great cook named Alba, she prepared us the delicious dish, it was very good.

 The entire experience at this hotel has been truly excellent, from the first minute we arrived.  I hope this review helps you.

title: Wonderful Stay for NYC
text: My wife and I stayed here in March 2022 for an entire week. The staff was beyond friendly. As any NYC space is the rooms are small but very well laid out to make the most of the space. The rooms, hallways, elevators and building were always kept clean. Great location between Bryant Park Subway and Grand Central, you can be on a train anywhere without a transfer in just two blocks. But even better is walking everywhere and this hotel is perfectly situated for that. A few great coffee and bagel shops within two or three blocks as well. Look forward to our next trip to NYC and will stay here again.

title: Best location and super friendly staff
text:
This hotel is outstanding. The location is unbeatable and the rooms are nice and clean, with a coffee machine , hairdryer, safe and fridge. The staff of the hotel is very very friendly . I rarely experienced such nice people, especially Michael and Rochelle are people with a high value and they have totally understood what it means to make their customers happy. They are very customer oriented and are trying always to find a right and good solution. These two guys are the best!!!
I will definitely stay at this hotel again when I am in New York next time.

title: Comfortable, basic business hotel
text:
Hyatt Centric at Fifth Ave and 39th is a comfortable, basic business hotel. 

The bedding is very comfortable, and large windows open for fresh air. The light fixtures are fussy and tricky (hotels should never put clever fixtures in hotel rooms: round switches that you'd think you twist but actually have to tap quickly but not let your finger rest on them....ugh) and the desk-level electrical outlet is blocked by a pole coming out of the desk so you can't use it (huh?).

Service is generally friendly but sometimes a bit rough around the edges.

The restaurant is now open for breakfast and super, super basic (think Denny's or comparable).

title: Hotel stay
text: They let us check in a few hours early and for free. That was a plus. Room was clean and everything worked well! Really appreciated the shower water pressure! Would stay here again! Thank you again Hyatt!

title: Midtown centric hotel
text: Great hotel close to the public library and Grand Central Station. The staff is wonderful and accommodating. A special mention goes out to effervescent Micheal, Evelyn and housekeeping manager Ivan, who was exceptionally efficient and kind enough to pay attention to every single detail. They made my stay a truly memorable one. I will certainly visit this little gem again.

title: A boutique hotel experience for those who want to stay in a chain hotel
text: I was very pleased with my stay at the Hyatt Centric Midtown 5th. The room was decent sized and extremely well designed. Plenty of outlets for all the tech people travel with today. Numerous different lighting opions in the room (I loved the motion sensor triggered night lights for when I woke up in the middle of the night to go to the bathroom!). While there is not a "classical closet" the room's hanging system provided excellent hanging space. The desk space was very large probably 8' long. (One nit there was not a lot of drawer space; a little unit under the huge desk would have been much appreciated). I was on the back of the building. The room was relatively dark as it faced a courtyard of the backs of buildings. That was also a plus, however, as it was one of the quietest rooms I've had in NYC. The bathroom was surspisingly large with great counter space. Front desk was excellent; acknowledged by Hyatt status and offered me the appropriate benefits. One last thing, most NY hotels of this size only have two elevators, this one had three and this was much appreciated as I never had to wait. I would definitley stay here again!

title: No heat or hot water.
text: First room had no heat or hot water. The front desk staff were extremely nice and helpful. They moved us to a different room which had heat and hot water. Overall the hotel was adequate as a NYC hotel, but the rooms are very dark and depressing and everything just seems slapped together by someone who decided to try to make a “hip NY hotel”. Standard bathroom with tiny sink, old bathtub. Beds were comfortable, lots of charging ports. Some of the reading lamps didn’t work. A cheap pod coffee maker with off brand pods. No breakfast but you are in the center of NYC so you can get food anywhere.

title: Amazing Staff, Amazing Stay
text: I booked this hotel for a business/pleasure trip. We arrived from Phoenix, AZ several hours before check-in and thankfully were able to check-in early.  The staff was amazing during the entire trip, and the hotel is in a great location. The room was comfortable and quiet.

title: Good Value in Manhattan
text: Hotel was clean, staff very friendly.  We enjoyed our stay.  Restaurant looked good, although we did not eat there.  Very close to NY Public Library and Bryant Park.  Great location when visiting mid town Manhattan.

title: A decent Centric
text:
While there's some minor issues to overcome, I had a solid, pleasant stay at this Hyatt Centric. 

As a Globalist, I did not get early room access nor an upgrade, but as a frequent traveler to NYC, I honestly don't expect to receive either in a market like New York City. That said, other Hyatt hotels within its vicinity have offered these benefits to me, and even just a verbal recognition that those benefits aren't available would have been nice.

That said, once I did get my room, it seemed to be newly renovated - it was vibrant, clean, and up to what I expect for a Hyatt Centric - which is pretty high standards.

I appreciated its abundance of light (natural & built-in), and the city view of the Empire State Building was awesome. I know there were reviews about the unrenovated rooms, but the new rooms are fantastic. On the 17th floor, it was very quiet - something appreciated with NY hotels.

AC & water pressure/heating was up to par for the very cold days during my stay.

Breakfast was a bit of a mess. At the restaurant, it seemed it was understaffed and the staff seemed stressed, and as a consequence, service was inattentive with basics missed. I can't blame them, though, considering how much they had to handle. The food was tasty, though.

In general, staff were generally friendly - a good measurement for NYC hotels.

While it wouldn't be my first choice in Midtown, I was generally happy with may stay & wouldn't hesitate at all to stay here again at this Hyatt Centric.

title: remodeled excellent hidden gem
text:
My favorite destination in NYC. Very friendly and helpful staff. 
Rooms are recently remodeled comfortable bedding and nice clean bathrooms.
Very reliable Wi-Fi. Also strong cellular service.
Excellent value

title: Great location!
text:
It was our first time staying at the Hyatt Centric and it was a great experience. The staff at the front desk were very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable.  

Great location! We could walk to almost all the major tourist attractions like Times Square, Empire State building, Central Park, Grand Central train station....

Lots of  restaurants and shopping close by.

The room looked brand new, very clean and I loved the design! Beautiful shower and soft and plush towels.  We didn't hear any noise from the city traffic.

I would recommend not travelling with large suitcases because there isn't room to store them.

title: Great hotel
text:
My wife and I stopped here for our wedding  anniversary for 5 nights last week and we cant recommend it enough. Excellent and very helpful staff and Anthony, the general manager upgraded our room and we had an amazing view of the Empire state building. The hotel is also in an excellent location for getting round Manhattan and has lots of nearby bars and restaurants, as well as Bryant park being a minute away. We will be back

Noel

title: Bare-bones 2-Star Property
text: NOT a 3 or 4 star property as it is listed.  Although front desk staff is friendly, this hotel has super small rooms that were very shopworn (tape holding molding on walls), no closet or iron/ironing board or other normal amenities terrible food from their limited room service options (inedible breakfast eggs, no possiblity of getting coffee).   Be warned that there is NO parking on site, and there isn't even a pull-in area for car drop-off, nor is there anyone at front to help unload and bring in luggage.    This property also doesn't honor World of Hyatt member benefits.

title: Perfect stay, great location
text: Great little hotel in the perfect location for a quick stay. I was on my own, but it's really absolutely a gem for a single or couple who wants to be in the city using a familiar brand hotel with friendly staff, nice amenities, an easy restaurant and an awesome location. Most of the hotels right around this one are triple the price and do not offer triple the experience. highly recommend.

title: Very poor experience
text:
I stayed at this hotel a few days ago and it was overall a terrible experience.
To start when I arrived the street was blocked completely because some utility personnel was performing some work. Water was flowing out in the street making it a mess just to get to the hotel. 
Upon arrival I was told that there was not water in the rooms. Reception did not have any idea as to when the water service was going to be restored. Also I must point out that nothing in the hotel website alerted customers about this major inconvenience. No alternative lodging ideas were offered. Overall this indicated to me that the hotel did not take any ownership of the issue. 
Deciding to checking (and praying that water would be restored soon, I checked in and no acknowledgment of my Globalist Hyatt status was offered. My assigned room was lugubrious with a view of walls of nearby buildings. A small workspace with an uncomfortable chair was not very inviting to do much there. 
Because there was no operating restaurant in the property, coupons were offered to order breakfast on line through a provider app. Unfortunately it was not working in my phone so I ordered through my laptop using the coupon code . In the end I had to pay for the breakfast.
Inexperienced staff?, no ownership of the customer experience?. Whatever it was I added up to a very poor stay.

title: Stay
text: Enjoyed the stay. Very clean hotel! Looks like it was recently renovated wish is nice. The only thing was the room size a little tight for a couple to stay.  Definitely Look to book the larger room if you are not traveling solo.

title: Decent Minus Breakfast
text:
Stay Report - 2/5 to 2/6

Location: The hotel is located on 39th Street between 5th and Madison.  Location wise that's great.  Easy walk to the Times Square, 42nd/Bryant Park or Grand Central Subway Stations.  There are also lots of restaurants around the hotel (I recommend Chili for Sichuan cuisine on 37th).  Do note though there is currently construction on 39th which has closed a lane and has led to a hell of a racket outside the hotel.

Hotel: The hotel is a standard mid level midtown property by which I mean it's a skinny high rise sandwiched between other skinny high rises.  The lobby is very pleasant and has a sitting area, two computer business center and a small coffee shop.  There are three elevators and they are really tiny and there can be long waits for them.

Check In: Standard New York check in experience by which I mean it was efficient but lacking any warmth.  I was thanked for being Globalist and asked if I wanted my late check out but not given any upgrade.  

Room: Small, it being New York and all.  What space there was was dominated by the large bed.  There was a tiny desk next to a faux closet in one corner, and there was a fridge and coffee maker but no microwave.  The bathroom was pretty nice albeit small.  Soundproofing however is awful.  I was on the 12th floor and I heard every noise from down below.  Also the apartments next door look directly into your room so be aware to guard your privacy. 

Dining: They do have a restaurant that serves dinner.  Glancing at the menu showed it's Italian food moderately priced.  Breakfast is via a delivery service called Butler.  Their menu was very limited and they forgot my drink.  Globalists are entitled to one main, one side and one drink.  That was a huge disappointment. 

Overall a good stay location wise and if you're just using it as a base of operations it's fine.  But if you have more than one person or will spend a lot of time in the room I'd stay elsewhere

title: Great Location, good stay
text:
I had a great stay at the Centric. I had a work meeting near 52nd Street and was taking the train to Penn Station so I wanted to be located between the two, the hotel was about a 20 minute walk to each. It's close to Times Sq., MSG, the library and the Empire State Building. 5th Avenue and Madison Ave were a block away. 

My room was modern and clean and the hotel staff were very nice. There is no restaurant onsite yet but one is in the works, being in NYC there are plenty of options near by. I felt pretty safe walking in the area alone at night.

title: A Gem in Midtown
text:
Super location with a most professional, helpful and happy staff.
Rooms functional and super clean, beds most comfortable.
The location in Midtown is most convenient to everything NYC has to offer.  The hotel is big enough to offer full services but small enough to offer a boutique experience.
We will definitely stay here again

title: Great stay with a group!
text: Visited the property with a group of 35 (kids and adults).  We were welcomed and made to feel right at home.  The rooms were very modern but still comfy and the room service was outstanding.  Will definitely stay here again as it was right in the middle of all the action!

title: Very nice hotel for its category
text: Great location (just outside of busy area but close to transportation). Rooms are more than adequate by NYC standards and has some nice touches like a Keurig machine, safe and mini fridge, Grohe fixtures and Toto toilets. The toilet and sink/shower are separated by a door which is makes sharing easier. Would recommend.

title: Great Location
text:
This is a relatively new hotel in a great location if you want to be centrally located down town.
No restaurant yet, but we understand there will be soon.
Rooms are reasonable size with a modern design, comfortable bed, lot's of natural light, storage and good comfortable bathroom with a great shower.
front desk is helpful and friendly.
only stayed overnight but would work for longer stay.
Very impressed for the price.

title: Incredible!!
text: This hotel is such an awesome place. The rooms were great! Extremely clean and laid out very well. I loved the motion censored lights on the floor for if you were walking in the dark. Unfortunately the restaurant wasn’t open yet, but I would definitely go back to try it. But my main highlight of this stay was the incredible staff!! Evelin, Michael, Rochelle, and Arlene were the absolute BEST! I can’t thank them enough for being so warm and welcoming and always leaving us with a smile. I would 100% come back here just for the incredible staff, but also the hotel is pretty freaking cool too. There’s no reason to doubt if you’d like to stay here, I would definitely book it again!

title: Overnight stay!!
text: Great experience!!! A clean hotel with friendly and helpful staff!!! Great find!! Also, very close to all the action and places that visited throughout our stay. We always try to stay at Hyatt Hotels because they never seem to disappoint!!

title: Great location
text: I truly think that this hotel is going to do very well. The location is just perfect, 2 minutes walking from Grand Central and the One Vanderbilt building, 5 from the Empire State Building, 10 from Times Square. It's completely renovated, fantastic style. It really worths.

title: NYC HYATT CENTRIC experience:
text:
Highly recommend…good rates, clean, close to shops, restaurants, tourist spots; Staff are efficient, attentive, helpful & friendly.
Will come back specially when you open your rooftop bar/restaurant .
Special thanks to Michael & Evelyn!😊

title: Perfect hotel at a fantastic midtown location
text: Our group just got back from a week long vacation to New York, where we stayed at the new addition to the Hyatt family of Centric hotels. Everything about the hotel was impeccable: the facility itself Nd the room, but most importantly, the Staff, which attended to all of our needs. Congratulations on a perfect hotel at a great location

title: Hot Water Problem.
text: Staying in this Hotel from Dec 20-24, the room is newly renovated & small as expected, good location, and helpful staffs. However, on Dec 21, there was no hot water for nearly 12 hours, which was the major issue during winter time. This water heater problem has happened a few times in this Hotel based on the previous reviews. Perhaps Hyatt Group should consider putting this Hotel in category 6.

title: A+ staff but various maintenance issues
text: I was traveling for a mix of personal and business reasons. This hotel is in a good location. The staff were wonderful but unfortunately we have several maintenance problems, including: heat and hot water did not work.  I could not shower for two days so intimately checked out early and moved hotels. No credit or compensation was provided.

title: Home away from home in NYC
text: Amazing staff, exceptional breakfast, fantastic value. The hotel is ideally located, and Rochelle, Evelyn, Michael and Yasmina treated me like a member of their family. What terrific ambassadors for the Hyatt brand.

title: Amazing trip to NY this past weekend!
text: This was my family's first trip to NYC and it was a great one, made all the better by the comfortable and positive experience at the hotel. While the fire alarm did go off in the early morning, the staff were of utmost consideration in making sure that our needs were accommodated and that this had minimal impact on our trip. Additionally, it was clear the staff at the hotel had all guests' safety as a priority. The room was clean with an amazing view of the city that myself and my family enjoyed: Would definitely stay here again and will be recommending it to anyone I know visiting the area.

title: SUPER-FRIENDLY STAFF
text: The hotel itself is "okay." It is very central, and it is easy to walk up or downtown. What makes this boutique hotel deserve five stars is that they have some of the nicest staff I have encountered. Everyone was very friendly to me. They were helpful and kind. And for that, I am very grateful. I often have to move a lot of clothes and I travel with a small dog, and the hotel staff could not have been nicer to the dog, and they always offered to help me schlepp my clothes around. I always felt that the staff would keep us all safe.

title: New but Old
text: Hotel is a category 3 at best. Despite being new, everything about it felt old. The decor is awful, hallways are tight, closets are open to the room, lighting is harsh, and amenities are nothing special. The hotel is not a relaxing place to be at. The price per night was ridiculously expensive given the quality of hotel. Nothing about this Hyatt is like other Centrics. Staff is okay. Room was clean.

title: Terrible Customer Service
text:
Pros: The rooms were nicely decorated and clean. The amenities had a very pleasant smell. The location was great (which was why I chose this hotel in the first place).
Cons: 
1. The rooms were tiny with no room to even leave a suitcase open. However, that is fairly typical for rooms in NYC, I had simply hoped for more from a Hyatt.
2. My room with a "view", that mind you I paid extra for, required you to crane your neck in the very corner of the room to see the Empire State building. The actual view as a series of water towers. Granted this might be the NYC version of view but it certainly is a more than a little misleading.
The bigger issues:
3. At multiple points I saw staff members at the front desk with their masks off.
4. I arrived at the hotel at 5:30 pm and still had to wait 45 minutes for my room to be cleaned. There is absolutely no reason why my room is not ready for me at 5:30 pm. 
The biggest problem:
5. One of our nights a fire alarm went off at 1 am. I have two young children who were obviously fast asleep. When the alarm was not shut off within a few minutes we obviously had to wake them up, dress them for the cold and then run down 18 flights of stairs. Only to be told that it was a false call. I am happy that it was a false call and that no one was hurt and nothing was damaged. However, I am very upset about the utter lack of acknowledgement from hotel management about the major inconvenience that this was for my and every other family staying there. It was an utter nightmare trying to get the kids back to sleep and absolutely affected the remainder of our trip because the kids were sleep deprived. It is unacceptable that there was not at the very least a letter of apology slipped under our door. Or perhaps some chocolates placed on the bed when it was made. Or a question by the front desk as we walked out the door that next morning asking how we were and sorry for the experience. Something. Anything. But instead all we got was utter silence as if it didn't happen. I truly expected more from a Hyatt hotel. I will absolutely not stay at this particular Hyatt ever again.

title: Clean and Trendy
text: The staff is friendly and kind, and the lobby/elevator has a wonderful smell of citrus.  Having stayed at several other NYC hotels in midtown, this is a welcoming feature!  Nice touch.  Very clean everywhere, and the beds are so comfortable.

title: Nice stay
text: The hotel was near the locations we needed to be close to ( I.e., Grand Central Station, NYU Hospitals, etc.). The room was very nice.  The self parking was not ideal because there were no parking garages near-by and it took sbout an hour to find parking.

title: Birthday Celebration in NYC!!!
text: Yesenia & her staff provided white glove service! All of our requests & needs were were accommodated with a smile. The hotel is centrally located & can walk to any location very easily. Would definitely stay at the same location again.

title: Great location and great quality!
text: I would definitely recommend this hotel for a vacation stay! It’s perfect location for almost all attractions and sites here in NYC. We walked everywhere and it was perfect. Great rooms and views. Staff was very friendly and so helpful. Manager was on site and welcomed my son with some candy! :) so nice!!

title: Outstanding Customer Service at Hyatt Centric
text: Hyatt Centric is a new hotel and there is still some lobby construction underway but it did not detract from my experience. The rooms are new, clean, minimalist, and functional. But the reason for my review is to complement the amazing front desk staff. I was traveling for business, and these folks were friendly, quick, and very attentive, calling me by name and knowing my room number, asking me if everything was going well on a daily basis. Evelin was absolutely amazing. She stored my luggage, requested another room for me facing away from the street, gave me a late check out, and offered the option of a car service which was excellent. I was very rushed getting my car to the airport and they quickly took my room keys to get me checked out and directed me right to my driver so I could be on my way. I cannot say enough about how professional and efficient the staff was. The manager also wished me goodbye as I was leaving. Thanks so much to Evelin and the team! I will definitely stay again.

title: Another great Hyatt experience!
text: Friendly and speedy check in/out, beautiful and clean rooms and great location. We love staying at the Hyatt hotels and this location did not disappoint, looking forward to staying in the near future.

title: Great for a Weekend in NYC
text: The Hyatt Centric was in a convenient location, central to everything in Manhattan.  We were able to walk to most destination.  The room was clean, bed was excellent and shower was warm with lots of water pressure.  The room was quite small and a little dark but it's NYC after-all.  If you don't plan on spending a ton of time in your while you are in NYC this is an excellent option for a clean, comfortable, centrally located hotel that represents good value for the money.

title: Great location, service and breakfast
text: It's a new hotel -- only a few months old.  They seem to have worked out all the bugs that are expected from a new hotel.  Our room was nicely appointed and always cleaned (despite COVID).  Everything from the soaps to towels, bedding were 5-star.  One big surprise was the Butler complimentary breakfast room service.  I'm a foodie, and I can tell you that the quality of the food was also 5-star.  (Try the avo toast with the Impossible sausage.)  We have a great story -- when we were in line at a show, my girlfriend discovered that she forgot her driver's license.  (Theaters required proof of vaccination and i.d.)  Michael at the front desk searched the room, found her wallet, took a photo of her i.d. and sent it to my phone.  We got into the show on time!  Thanks Anthony.  You have a great property and crew!

title: Over priced, tiny room.
text: My wife and I just returned from a trip to NYC and we stay 4 nights at this Hyatt (39th and 5 Ave).   This hotel is way over priced the upgraded room that we reserved had barely enough room to walk around the bed.   No closet.   The hotel's restaurant was not working.  So they told us about a place were we could order breakfast and have it delivered to the room.   Breakfast was good, but THERE IS NO TABLE IN THE ROOM FOR 2 PEOPLE TO EAT!!!!!!!!!!!!  we had to take turns standing and eating!.  The maid only came twice to clean.   The phone did not work.   The internet was unreliable.   the bathroom had a sliding door because a normal door would not have enough room to open - it would hit the bed.   And the view from the high floor (which was extra) was a view of an uninteresting building across the street.   DO NOT BOOK IN THIS HOTEL -  it is a rip off

title: Nice hotel - great staff.
text: This is a nice hotel, well located in mid-town Manhattan. The staff were great and very helpful. The hotel is rather small, but the rooms were nice. Unfortunately, the wifi was down for one evening and most of the following next day. This was more than a mild inconvenience as I was travelling on business and needed wifi to work. Without the wifi issues I would have given a 4 out of 5.

title: Thanksgiving Week.
text: Awesome experience. Easy walking distance to all main sites in the city. Thanks a lot and shoutout to all the staff for going the extra mile to make our stay comfortable. We will definitely come back..

title: Great Location!
text: We went to NY for Thanksgiving. This hotel is a great location for the parade, Central Park, shopping, food, etc. The staff was friendly and courteous! The rooms were small yet comfortable. Great gym too!

title: Great hotel for a family vacation!
text: This hotel was a great value, had a great location to experience a lot of NYC (near a lot of food options, classic NYC locations, et cetera), a friendly staff, and comfortable, clean rooms. Would certainly recommend for a family vacation in the city. 👍

title: New Hyatt Centric at 39th and 5th is clean, comfortable and in a great location.
text: from initial greeting an check-in by the front desk staff to our late departure with airport travel arranged by the staff, everything was very pleasant. Looking forward to the rooftop bar opening in the spring.

title: NYC
text: This was a brand new hotel, staff was so nice and the rooms were very spacious. This hotel is close to everything, including Grand Central Station and the Empire State Building. I would stay here again.

title: Clean, Cordial and Convenient
text: A new property in a great location! Plus, it has one of the friendliest staffs I’ve ever come across in NYC.  Shout-out to manger Anthony, and also to Michael. The Hyatt beds are comfortable, towels are fluffy, and the toiletries are quality. There’s a big flatscreen, good WIFI, mini-fridge and a nice selection of Keurig. But I need to mention that the rooms are unusually dark-- due to other buildings’ proximity, as well as a dark color palette and the “boutique-y” lighting style.  Just be aware of that.  As for me, I will certainly be returning—with nightlights in tow.  I’m looking forward to the opening of the restaurant and rooftop bar!

title: Great Location, Clean Rooms
text:
Great location, new hotel, friendly staff. 

Walking distance to Bryant Park, shopping and food. For a New York hotel, the room size was decent. Very clean and modern decor (green walls, lounge chair). Other room highlights include a Keurig machine w/cream, nice rain shower head, and small desk.  15th floor room was quiet from street noise. Easy luggage storage when early check in was not available. Hard to tell how much of the lobby is closed down for construction or as a COVID precaution, but staff was friendly and we don’t stay at hotels to hang out in the lobby. Would definitely stay again.

title: Hot water cut out in the morning
text:
