The hotel was nice enough, but the hot water cut out in the morning.  The front desk staff said it was building-wide, and maintenance doesn't work on Sundays.  We had to take cold showers.

The room was fine and clean, though not much more that just the bed, bathroom, and tv.  The location is an easy walk from grand central station. The check in time isn't until 4, which was a bit of an issue because we were going to a 5 PM show, but cabs and ubers are easy to get, and you can leave your luggage at the front desk early before you check in, and then after you check out, which is convenient

title: Location is great but the service needs time to improve
text:
Very very slow butler service breakfast. They told me it will take 1-1.5 hr and I said yes. They text me after 1hr 11min saying it's prepared and on its way.  I called them 20min after getting the 2nd text and they said they need another 15 min so I canceled it otherwise I will miss my train. I was so hangry that time when I canceled it. :( 

I know room service takes time so I even asked the day before should I pre-order the breakfast. The person who answered the phone said the system may not let me pre-order. Anyway, unless you get plenty of time otherwise don't order the breakfast even if you have the globalist membership (which I have). 

The hotel is new and the location is great. The night I checked in I was told that they are trying to fix the hot water but we didn't run into a problem. I will wait for some time before thinking about going back.

title: Never again
text: Tiny rooms, no business center, no food or snacks and staff is hard to get their attention.   I come to NYC for business a lot but I will be looking for a different place to stay next time.   I won't recommend this for casual travellers as well

title: Great location and hotel
text: Hotel is fairly new with boutique vibe. Well located midtown East walking distance to grand central and attractions. Lobby is a bit small but comfortable. On-site restaurant and rooftop deck will be open in a few months. Room (13th floor) was very clean and comfortable with good storage and blackout blinds for sleeping. Sound insulation was good.  Bed was very comfy and climate control was excellent. Bathroom was well laid out with excellent water pressure and temperature, and good toiletries.  Small desk for work area. All staff I interacted with were friendly and helpful when needed. I recommend this hotel.

title: Great location, very clean room!
text: I’d stay here again in a heartbeat. Friendly staff, great location. Love the lighting in the room and the marble shower was fantastic. I’d definitely choose this hotel over several others that pop up in the area.

title: NY stay at Hyatt 39th & 5th
text: Hotel under construction.  No amenities available.  There is noise.  Some of the room doors are next to each other, causing a loud noise as it opens and closes.  The dark green paint in the room makes it very dark.  Location is excellent!

title: Friendly new boutique hotel steps from B’way!
text: Our excitement about returning to Broadway theater after a 2 year pandemic hiatus was underscored by finding a fantastic new boutique hotel just a few short blocks from the theater district - Hyatt Centric at 39th & 5th. Clean - friendly - great find!! We will be back!

title: New Property Near Grand Central/Times Square
text: The new Hyatt Centric has many positives - new rooms, fast elevators and very quiet rooms (including facing the street).  The rooms are decent sized for Manhattan and decorated well.  Currently (OCT 2021) there is no restaurant and roof deck is not open either.  For some reason the heater/air handler couldn’t be adjusted (odd for a new place) so the room was a bit too warm.  Lastly, good sized bathroom but few things to fix - two hooks for towels (2 people in the room) and water seeped on floor from shower…. Can be fixed and typical of new hotel. Overall there is a lot of potential for the Hyatt Centric and hope the management can pull through on the opening quirks.

title: Mostly Good!
text: Front desk and management staff were exceptional and professional in every way. Location of hotel is superb. Bed linens and pillows are best in the hospitality industry. The recently opened property is an asset to “the greatest city in the world.”

title: Great Location
text: I had a wonderful experience at Hyatt Centric 39th & 5th. First of all, the location is perfect. I was able to comfortably walk to a concert at Madison Square Garden and loved how close it is to other big spots like Bryant Park and Grand Central. The staff was very friendly, the room was clean, and the view from my balcony was great! I would definitely stay here again!

title: Great hotel! Great Location!
text: Recently opened, this was my first stay at the Hyatt Centric.  The mid-town location is ideal.  Within view of 5th Avenue, its a short walk to Lexington and the East Side  as well as Times Square and the West Side. The hotel is small but has all the conveniences.  Check-in and out went very smoothly.  Staff was efficient, pleasant and knowledgeable. The room was small but well laid out with adequate work space and lighting. All Globalist benefits were provided and although the on-site restaurant was closed, snacks were available for purchase and breakfast by “Butler” was available. Definitely take advantage of this amazing service.  For anyone planning a trip to New York City, I highly recommend this hotel!

title: Great place, friendly staff!
text: This was a perfect getaway for me and my wife. We had a room with a view of the Empire State Building,  going to sleep looking at those lights is amazing. The staff was great, went above and beyond. Thanks!

title: Weekend Stay in NYC
text: Everything was exceptional…clean, new and friendly service. Wish the restaurant and roof was open but I guess that’s a reason to return. We were only on the third floor but elevators were quick which is always a plus.

title: VERY small rooms and nothing open at the hotel
text: I would highly recomment staying at the Hyatt House in NYC and not this hotel.  There is nothing at this hotel to do and nothing is open.  That combined with the SMALL room and only one little desk chair to sit on made this experience miserable.

title: A great stay in NYC!
text: The one thing that makes this hotel great are the people working there, my only complaint is my room was a bit dusty and dark, perhaps put a light over the work desk area, also I could have used a luggage stand as the closet area was too small to hold my bag, other then that my stay was perfect, I slept great and walked everywhere including to Broadway to see a show, the staff was fun and always willing to help out with questions, Thanks for a great stay!!

title: The Best Little Hotel in Midtown!
text: My colleague and I needed rooms in a hotel near Grand Central Terminal because we had to be at work at 5am the next morning. I found the brand new Hyatt Centric 39th & 5th and booked it, thinking "It must be decent if it carries the Hyatt name." When we arrived, we found a brand new, charming little hotel with a beautiful lobby and friendly, attentive and very efficient front desk staff. In about two minutes, we had our room keys and hopped on the elevator to find our respective rooms. My "Manhattan-size" room was sparkling clean, well appointed, thoughtfully laid out and had the most comfortable king size bed. I couldn't have been happier and spent two nights there declaring to myself that "this will now be go to Manhattan hotel." I've already booked it for another trip. Besides its fantastic location in the heart of midtown, the Hyatt Centric 39th & 5th is a wonderfully affordable hotel with clean, safe and very comfortable rooms.

title: Very friendly staff;
text:
Everybody at this hotel to a person was welcoming, friendly, and accommodating.  Even the maintenance folks downstairs by where the fitness center is.  It's like the Hyatt in Kauai.  Except this is NYC, where you don't expect that.

The rooms are NYC-sized (i.e. not huge) but tidy, clean, and functional. Foodservice, which is currently provided/delivered by a 3rd party company, is probably the weakest point of this property-- limited selection and dilatory delivery.  I'm looking forward to when the property has its own restaurant/breakfast service up and running.

Above all, I think the mgmt of this new property is committed to customer satisfaction and continual improvement: when I checked in, the mgr was personally greeting people and making sure everybody was accommodated and happy.

title: Credit were credit is due: Great service recovery.
text:
----- NEW REVIEW -----
Some background: I've stayed this property twice. The first stay was terrible, and I rated this 1*. I've had to remove this review as TA wont allow me to post more than one review every 3 months. For this reason I've included the old review below.

Credit where credit is due: after a first stay that was really bad (my other review is still up, below) this stay has been exemplary. The hotel, and in particular GM Anthony really did try to make things right. Often (and I personally think this is why people complain) guests are just after some points, but this is the easy way out; and, after spending those points, I'm sure guests are back to resentment.

Anthony, on the other hand, took time out of his day and we had almost an half an hour discussion. After this discussion I made the decision to give the hotel another chance and I'm glad I did.

Before my stay Anthony and his team were of great help arranging the many packages I had arrive to the hotel, Amazon decided to deliver almost every item in a separate box resulting in 13 packages. These were all waiting for me when I got to my room. I've only had this happen at the Park Hyatt Seoul before and this was a really nice gesture.

Check in this time was extremely smooth and very swift. The woman at check in, I didn't catch her name, was very hospitable and a big difference when compared to my previous stay. This time I stayed in room XX07, and I can definitely recommend paying extra for this room category. The room is situated much farther away from the elevator and this meant a much better sleep at night. I will add, however, that this room is opposite a linen cabinet that I presume is used by housekeeping so there is some noise during the day. While this room faces the street, the windows are definitely well sound proofed, as the only traffic that was audible were police sirens. Normal traffic wasn't audible. Great.

I tried the gym this stay and it was great for a hotel gym. The gym has three treadmills, an elliptical and stationary bike. Most importantly, however, the dumbells go up to 70 pounds. Most hotel gym only have weights up to 50 so this is something I particularly liked. The gym is of decent size, particularly for Manhattan. 

Location is perfect. Comparing it to the Hyatt Centric Times Square, you are just a few blocks away from the craziness that is Times Square, and for this reason I actually prefer this hotel's location. Fifth avenue is around the corner and central park is 15 min away by foot. 

For those thinking of using BLADE: I did a speed test on a week day at 4PM, and uber to the helipad + BLADE + transfer to T4 at JFK was two minutes slower than an uber straight to JFK. It can take up to 20min to get from the hotel to the helipad because of Manhattan traffic.

I would like to thank Anthony for his hospitality and his efforts into making things right. This was a wonderful stay and I have already booked my next stay for my trip next month.

----- OLD REVIEW, RATED 1* --------
I'll start by saying I was really looking forward to my stay, having stayed at the Hyatt Centric Times Square property a few times, which is amazing. Long story short: book that one instead.

Prior to arrival, requested a room on a high floor away from the elevator. Arrived at the property at 4PM - was assigned a room on the 8th floor with a view of a brick wall. I'm a Hyatt explorist member - and while this isn't the highest tier in Hyatt, you'd think they would at least assign a better room. Asked for a different room, but was told the hotel was fully booked (yet still selling rooms to the night across different categories at 4PM... interesting)

We put a DND sign to the room as soon as we entered. We had valuables worth 10k+ USD in the room that didn't fit the safe so we didn't want anyone to enter our room.

Our bathroom had issues: the water wouldn't drain. I raised this and specifically asked if maintenance can fix this AFTER we checked out. Instead, maintenance shows up 15 min later, knocking the door with the DND sign hanging right there, so I sent them away. Spent 2 hours in the city, came back to see someone had entered our room. Foot marks in the bathroom, and 2 towels on the bed. Called the operator and asked why anyone would enter the room - was told 1802 requested towels. We stayed in 802. I understand mistakes happen but I asked the operator why anyone would enter a room with a DND sign on, and operator admitted that shouldn't happen. I ask for an investigation, the next day I get a different story: the leak in the bathroom had to be fixed. Clearly one of these stories is true. Got an apology email from the GM, who managed to spell my last name wrong. You'd think if you're in damage control mode to get your guest's name right.

Rooms are OK but walls paper thin - we overheard everything the couple next to us was discussing, even at the lovely time at 2AM. There is also CONSTANT beeping from the elevator, clearly audible in the room throughout the day. This drove us completely insane.

Our flight is not until 10PM, but we are ready to check out at 8AM. We are completely done here.

Location is fine. Extremely small lobby, no bell man to assist with luggage.

The Hyatt Centric Times Square is usually around $20 more. Stay there.

title: Hyatt Centric- Review! GREAT STAY!!!  Recommend this brand new hotel!!! Fabulous staff! Rooms! Amenities! Read on!
text:
The hotel is beautiful, clean, excellent service, welcoming staff beginning with Mark at the fromt desk who helps  accommodate each guest request upon arrival and greets with a warm genuine smile. The front desk staff during the day includes Rochelle, Jasmine and Freedom! Who are each welcoming, kind, accommodating at both check in and throughout my entire stay!! Vernon is at the desk throughout the evening and as energetic, kind, helpful, welcoming, and ensures all is in order, safe and attended to throughout the evening! 

The hotel is brand new!! Walk into the beautiful well laid out lobby.  colorful, clean, plenty of room to spread out, comfy navy couches, amd big window to look out while doing business, reading or relaxing, amd a breakfast area opened till 11:30am offering fresh pastries, teas and coffees! 

The hotel also has a brand new GYN downstairs with plenty of workout equipment and machines to use! Feel great after workout!! An entire separate sink, washroom, bathrooms downstairs to wash up after a great workout!! 

The rooms are SPACIOUS! Well laid out!! The bed is super comfortable! King size bed with excellent bedding! You will have a great night sleep! 
The room is decorated with art work, painting above bed, and a separate seating area- couch/chair and foot rest! There are draws and hanging space for plenty of clothes!! The window has black out shades so you can use for good nights sleep  and open for sunlight during day! There is a large TV- you can use chrome cast or bring your own Amazon Firestick and the engineer will be happy to help you with any questions or needs, set ups, and is super kind, patient and happy to help successfully! 

The bathroom is stacked with fluffy white towels, soaps, shampoos, conditioners, tissues, clean !! Amd nicely decorated! The shower is a rain full shower and spacious as well!! You will enjoy a nice hot shower whether it’s after your workout , first in morning, or after a day walking NYC!! 

There are so many outlets available around bed as well! And plenty of lights , night lights, lamp and all done very meticulously and cleanly!!! 

Ivan is head of housekeeping staff and is also full of smiles, welcoming! And helps to make sure you are stocked with all the items you would like !!! Very generous and attentive!! 

The refrigerator  in room is added bonus to keep drinks and snacks if you choose!! Also a safe in the room if you should need one!! 

A wonderful stay!! I would absolutely  recommend and would certainly  return when I’m
Back in the area!!! 

Thank you to the entire staff!!! For a wonderful stay!!!!

title: Wanted a view😫
text:
We arrived at 4pm only to be told no view and no restaurant or rooftop and there was nothing they can do fully booked ...the room was small but very clean the hallway very narrow hard to get your bags in ..
If I had to stay more than a night I'm sorry this would not be it due to the lack of amenities.

title: Great Midtown Location
text: Enjoyed our recent stay at this Hyatt.  Great location, within walking to restaurants, bars (try Mulligans around the corner), and Times Square. Our room was spacious, quiet, and clean. Michael, at the front desk was wonderful.  Our bags were delayed at the airport and he was very reassuring that the hotel would inform us when they arrived.  He ended up delivering them personally at 12:30 in the morning. Terrific service!

title: Nicely located, clean Hotel
text:
This is a fairly new hotel within the Hyatt chain.   The rooms as they are on the small end as all hotels in the NYC area are, they use every square inch wisely.  Everything was clean, and the front desk responded to all questions, professionally and promptly.
Thank you to everyone there!

title: Average hotel
text: Room was clean but they do not clean until every third day of your stay. Wish there was an option for daily cleaning, especially if you provide proof of vaccination. Rooms were small as expected, but it was fine. I wish they had cleaned surfaces better--there were finger prints from previous occupants all over the place. Also no blackout curtains and people in the buildings across can see clearly into your room (as you can clearly see into theirs).

title: Hyatt centric 39th & 5th recently opened and it was beautiful comfortable and very high end in room Decor. Would highly
text: Beautiful new hotel with nice size rooms. Beautiful rooms and bathrooms. Big comfortable king size bed with large TV and ample space for your clothes. Air conditioning worked really well and automatic lights when you get out of gef

title: Perfect Experience
text:
Came with friends for a quick trip to NYC for friends' first trip to NYC. The hotel location is perfect, close to everything we wanted to explore. The staff was very friendly, professional, accommodating and helpful; always greeting us with a smile and asking how everything was with our stay, The room was comfortable with nice, funky furnishings and all the modern touches you'd need. Though rooms are on smaller size compared  to other cities, they were larger than I expected for NYC. Amazed how quiet the rooms were (no street noise or from hallways/other rooms).

The hotel is new, so everything isn't open/completed. The Butlr delivery service for breakfast was efficient and tasty. I look forward to returning to try the restaurant and bar, once they open. 

While our stay was amazing, I do offer the following feedback to the property...the lobby has a coffee bar, I wish the property offered a market/pantry to get drinks (soda, juice, water) and snacks along with ice and ice buckets for rooms since we had to get drinks from a store. Bathrooms need more places to hang towels/clothes than the one towel hook. Left no place to hang clothes while showering and makes it difficult to be environmentally conscious by reusing towels when you don't have any place to hang damp towels. 

Definitely will stay here again.

title: Amazing Hotel
text: I came to the city to visit with friends and family as a last minute idea. When I booked the Hyatt Centric I was not expecting such a beautiful hotel with what I would say was the best all around staff I have experienced in a hotel in many years. If you get a chance to visit New York this is the hotel to stay at it’s kept amazing clean by a great housekeeping team and the front desk team are extremely friendly and helpful.

title: A small but efficient hotel in the heart of Manhattan.
text: We attended a freinds wedding and this hotel was conveniently located. We like that the hotel didn’t have a huge lounge that made it easier to go in and out without facing lots of people. Room was small but well designed with all of the amenities including a mini freeze. Staffs were friendly and the front desk staff were profession and courteous.

title: Nice property in a convenient location!
text: What a wonderful place to stay while on business or for pleasure in NYC. Conveniently located at 39th and Madison, a very short walk from 5th Ave., this property is very clean and friendly.  I will be staying again! One note, the hotel states 5th and 39th, but if you are getting a taxi or ride share, go to Madison and 39th.  It is just on the left side of the street walking toward 5th.

title: Excellent new property in a great location
text: First time staying here as it opened very recently. The location is excellent. The staff is superb. It was quiet, well appointed and perfect for a NYC stay. Rooms aren’t huge but big enough. Very well decorated. My room was in a back corner and was very quiet. AC worked beautifully. TV was perfect with lots of channels. WiFi was fine. Only issue is kitchen isn’t open yet but should be soon along with their rooftop bar which should open by Spring. Terrific staff; incredibly friendly. Will stay again for sure.

title: Excellent
text: New hotel in a great location, near Brian Park, Rooms are relatively large for New York (we stayed a couple + 2 children), Quiet rooms, everything new, lobby a bit small but not disturbing, Feel safe on the hotel street, near Fifth Avenue excellent service

title: Modern clean and quiet
text: Quiet and comfortable. Food service was outstanding and easy to follow. Close to a grand Central station for easy metro access. They offered $50 for early check in and I felt very welcomed. Room was big and didn’t hear another person the whole stay

title: Very nice, new hotel in the heart of Manhattan
text: Checked out on Sunday, and could not have been happier with our stay. Our room was a nicely appointed 12th floor standard King room. Everything about our stay was exactly what we wanted. Do not hesitate to book this new hotel.

title: Updated and great location
text: Good sized rooms for NYC right in Manhattan. Friendly staff and nice, clean. Modern design made it seem to be newly renovated. Convenient to both Grand Central and Penn without being directly in a noisy area such as times square. Would return

title: Not really Hyatt standard
text: The hotel is new, but boy, they did cut corners when renovating. Wall paper is scratched all over, some outlets did not work, poorly furnished edges, etc. No sound proofing whatsoever. We could hear neighbors above walking and people next door talking. We got a room facing inner yard and it was dark, noisy (there is an industrial fan outside). Even through we were on 11 floor, the noise was quite loud even with window closed. When I opened the window once the room was filled with a smell of burnt oil, I think the fan serves a restaurant. No body cream, no bathrobes. I stayed at Hyatt Centric Tokyo and it was amazing. NYC is nothing even close to the same standard. I guess its the city of low standards when it comes to hotels, so consider that when choosing where to stay.

title: Perfect stay at the new Hyatt Centric 16 E 39 St Manhattan
text:
Hyatt Centric Hotel 16 East 39 St Manhattan is an oasis of quiet elegant simplicity in a city where this is very rare. From the moment I entered the hotel the reception by staff and the physical ambience were  inviting, calm and warm.

Michael ,who checked me in, listened carefully and responded swiftly to my questions about breakfast, TV channels and request for extra towels and bath gel. 

In the room, I liked the gentle fresh color scheme of tourquoise and cream with hints of navy blue.
First I took a warm shower in the spacious bathroom and tried the extra smooth sumptuous cotton sheets of the highest thread count.

This stay at the Hyatt Centric provided the quiet calm I needed to restore my energy to face the challenges of a normal day in the Big Apple.

At checkout, Arlene was very helpful giving me easy precise directions to my meeting a short distance away. Also I noticed the presence of General Manager Mark during check-in and General Manager Anthony during check out near by. This confirms for me that outstanding customer experience is number one priority of this Hyatt  team.

In fact, I felt so good that I plan to return again which is why I have booked my next two stays at this Hyatt.
Charles

title: Very nice stay!
text: We checked out this morning and everything about our stay was very nice. Well appointed room. Nice bathroom. Location cannot be beat, in my opinion. We would not hesitate to stay at the Hyatt Centric 39th and 5th again in the future.

title: Do yourself a favor abs stay here
text:
The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, they hand wrote out some amazing suggestions for places to visit in the city.  The rooms were immaculate. We met the GM he showed us where the rooftop bar will be, we will probably come back just to see it when completed.  

I highly recommend staying here, they created a family owned B&B type environment

title: Look No Further!
text:
My client and I recently traveled to NYC for a few days and boy ol boy, this was the perfect place to stay! From the moment we checked in we felt welcomed and valued as a guest. The hotel staff did an excellent job going over everything in detail as it pertained to our stay. The rooms were spacious considering a hotel in NYC. If you're looking for a nice view- reserve the Empire Suite, it's amazing! 
Mark and Anthony did an amazing job communicating with us during our stay as well as making sure we had everything we need. Again, if you're searching for the best place to stay LOOK NO FURTHER!

title: Billed as a boutique hotel but is a Hyatt Place
text: This “place” somehow bills itself as a boutique but has none of those touches — You need to get yourself and your bags through two narrow doors and into a very small lobby without help, rooms have no robes, mini bars are not stocked, room service has no wine or liquor, etc.   And be warned that contrary to all advertising on the website the rooftop bar / restaurant has not opened even the hotel has been operational a few months.

title: Great stay!
text:
We stayed here for one night with our 5 yr old on his first trip to NYC on his first adventure in NYC.  Room was ready upon arrival.  Great location walkable to Grand Central, Ny public library and Times Square. Hotel has a small boutique feel which I haven’t seen in Hyatt brand prior.

We were in 1401.  Larger than expected but small as you would expect for an NYC hotel room.  Great use of small, clean and beautifully decorated. Small bathroom but toilet was separate from shower (huge plus when traveling with a 5 yr old)

Restaurant and bar aren’t open yet, but hotel does have room service.

A huge thank you to Michael and Jasmine for making our stay so wonderful! We can’t wait to return!

title: Great location in Midtown
text:
This hotel is newly renovated and did not have everything up and running when I visited unfortunately. The rooftop bar and breakfast area were not available yet. The hotel itself is in good shape (since I'm a building inspector, I will say I think the general contractor could have done a better job with some of the final finishes). 
The staff more than made up for these things tho! Very friendly, helpful and accomodating.

I would definitely ask when booking about the room view. I stayed in Room 1602 which is tucked into a corner and very dark (so this is great if you want to sleep in and the black out shades work great too!) However, if you want light and a city view, this is definitely not the best room.

title: Nice location
text: The location is really good and the service is great too. Close to subway, 12 minutes walk to time square. Ton of places to shops around the hotel. The room is nice and doesn’t feel too small. Will stay there again

title: New Hyatt Centric hotel in NYC
text: It was exciting to be one of the first people to stay at this hotel. It’s a brand new hotel, everything was new and clean! I loved the large screen TV with Chromecast, the light fixtures, and the shower. The bed and sheets were really comfortable. This is a great location and there are so much shops and restaurants nearby. The staff was really friendly and helpful. I felt really welcomed as everyone greeted me and they all seemed really excited to be there. Special shout out to Arlene & Michael at the front desk. I would stay at this hotel just for the friendly staff.
